2190fb18-a6c3-403a-82a3-2e1631817ce5.description: This qualification is for those who currently have management responsibilities but have not completed any formal training. The Award supports the development of core leadership abilities in areas such as setting targets and managing the achievement of team objectives. It is also an ideal qualification to develop practising team leaders who are seeking to move up to the next level of management. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5934/5 and ILM Qualification Number 8600-11)
2190fb18-a6c3-403a-82a3-2e1631817ce5.name: Level 3 Award in Leadership & Management (8600-11)

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully completed all components of the qualification and developed knowledge and skills in two or more optional topic areas such as planning work, presentations, giving briefings, motivating others, developing self, discipline, recruitment, staff induction, training, coaching, quality management, delegating, leading meetings, marketing, developing relationships, mentoring and mental health.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include problem solving, innovation, change, creativity, customer service, business writing, contract management, incident management, security, service operations, environmental issues, procurement, project management, health and safety, performance management, budgeting, resource efficiency, conflict management, stress management, negotiation, networking,  information systems and  managing remote workers.

237faed9-16de-4606-92e3-6fe877fec9bf.description: This qualification is designed for practicing team leaders, to help them become more effective and confident in their leadership role. The Award is also suitable for new or aspiring team leaders as it supports them to make the transition from working in a team to leading a team. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5928/X and ILM Qualification Number 8000-11)
237faed9-16de-4606-92e3-6fe877fec9bf.name: Level 2 Award in Leadership & Team Skills - 8000-11

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved the Level 2 Award in Leadership and Team Skills. They have developed their skills and knowledge from two or three optional topics which may include leading a team, setting team objectives, planning and monitoring work, improving team performance, developing a team, briefing a team, effective team working, working within organisational guidelines, using resources, employee induction and coaching.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include self-development, self-management, understanding change, workplace communication methods, providing quality to customers, meeting customer requirements, solving problems, health and safety, diversity, business improvement techniques, enterprise awareness, legal requirements, using data, waste management and sales.

e10800bb-a1a6-46c7-8576-671a5ec319d9.description: This qualification is for those who currently have management responsibilities but have not completed any formal training and are seeking to move up to the next level of management. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5961/8 and ILM Qualification Number 8600-21)
e10800bb-a1a6-46c7-8576-671a5ec319d9.name: Level 3 Certificate in Leadership & Management - 8600-21

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include problem solving, innovation, change, creativity, customer service, business writing, contract management, incident management, security, service operations, environmental issues, procurement, project management, health and safety, performance management, budgeting, resource efficiency, conflict management, stress management, negotiation, networking,  information systems and  managing remote workers.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include self-development, improving team performance, monitoring work, team development, legal guidelines, diversity, stakeholder communication, enterprise awareness, setting objectives, collecting and using data, waste management, selling, leading complex activities, managing risk and financial management.

249ae020-757a-49f0-b6ba-73bc0d6210d0.description: This Award is designed for project managers, department heads, and other practising middle managers. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5855/9 and ILM Qualification Number 8607-11)
249ae020-757a-49f0-b6ba-73bc0d6210d0.name: Level 5 Award in Leadership & Management (8607-11)

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include resource management, recruitment, information management, work analysis, using statistics, facilities management, leading teams, giving presentations, lean methodologies, environmental performance, managing remote workers, partnership working, organisational governance, information management, coaching, mentoring, and managing mental health.

4ef81274-c56b-4870-ae4e-7581154c8f57.description: This Award is designed for project managers, department heads, and other practising middle managers. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5854/7 and ILM Qualification Number 8607-21)

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include leading a complex activity, equality and diversity, managing risk, delegating authority, developing people, developing leadership styles, financial management, health and safety, marketing, team motivation, problem solving,  change management, organisational culture, financial statements, budget planning, marketplace economics, mental toughness and operations research.

75647ffc-2be9-4e44-b59f-826a4030b5b7.description: This qualification is for aspiring professionals taking their first step into line management, or those with some experience of managing a team or project to deliver clearly defined outcomes. This qualification is aligned with the ‘on-programme’ elements of the Supervisor/Team Leader Standard. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/1166/6 and ILM Qualification Number 8410-01)
75647ffc-2be9-4e44-b59f-826a4030b5b7.name: Level 3 Diploma for Managers - 8410-01

badge_template_activities.title: This person has developed their knowledge of leadership theories, team dynamics, building relationships with colleagues and customers, effective workplace communication techniques, project management tools, problem solving approaches, decision making techniques, budget management, time management tips, developing emotional intelligence and raising self-awareness.

This person can set goals and targets for their team, monitor task progress, communicate effectively, develop and support individuals, plan and run meetings, review team and individual performance, produce management reports, plan and implement a project, identify and solve problems, make decisions, build relationships across an organisation and  review their own leadership practice.

The individual has attained 38 credits (amounting to 370 hours Total Qualification Time) by achieving the learning outcomes and meeting the assessment requirements for all mandatory units. There are no optional units in this qualification.

aaf6d1c2-fc94-442f-bb2d-0b6310178123.description: This qualification aims to provide the knowledge, skills and understanding to effectively coach or mentor others within an organisational context. It is suitable for managers and those with significant responsibility for coaching and mentoring as part of their daily role. It is also designed to develop individuals planning to move into a development role or start a career as a coach or mentor. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3758/8 and ILM Qualification Number 8588-21)
aaf6d1c2-fc94-442f-bb2d-0b6310178123.name: Level 5 Certificate in Effective Coaching and Mentoring - 8588-21

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved the Level 5 Certificate in Effective Coaching and Mentoring. They understand the purpose of coaching and mentoring in an organisational context and can explain the similarities and differences. They can present the case for the business benefits of coaching and mentoring. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values of an effective coach and mentor.

This person can manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support effective coaching or mentoring by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They maintain records and can recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

3a3d9eb2-947a-438a-8830-fc24a155ce42.description: This Diploma is designed for project managers, department heads, and other practising middle managers. The qualification helps people to develop a broad range of leadership skills and experience, improve personal performance and prepare for senior management responsibilities. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5856/0 and ILM Qualification Number 8607-31)
3a3d9eb2-947a-438a-8830-fc24a155ce42.name: Level 5 Diploma in Leadership & Management - 8607-31

badge_template_activities.title: This person has focused on a wide range of work-related areas which may include managing improvements, making a financial case, developing critical thinking, leading innovation, developing individuals, managing stress, managing conflict, organisational culture and ethics, customer relations, and implementing workplace projects.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include resource management, recruitment, information management, work analysis, using statistics, facilities management, leading teams, giving presentations, lean methodologies, environmental performance, managing remote workers, partnership working, organisational governance, information management, coaching, mentoring, and managing mental health.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include leading a complex activity, equality and diversity, managing risk, delegating authority, developing people, developing leadership styles, financial management, health and safety, marketing, team motivation, problem solving,  change management, organisational culture, financial statements, budget planning, marketplace economics, mental toughness and operations research.

2f281f3a-3ae4-4d8a-9fc3-e4fb2b6d8e75.description: This apprenticeship is designed for first-line managers such as Supervisors, Team Leaders, Project Officers and Shift Supervisors who work in the private, public or third sector. The qualification is suitable for first-line managers in all sizes of organisation with operational/project responsibilities or responsibility for managing a team to deliver a clearly defined outcome. (IFATE Standard Reference Number: ST0384 and ILM Qualification Number 9308-12)
2f281f3a-3ae4-4d8a-9fc3-e4fb2b6d8e75.name: 9308-12 Level 3 End-point Assessment for ST0384/AP03 Team Leader/Supervisor - (Distinction)

badge_template_activities.title: This person has met the distinction grade for the Level 3 Team Leader/Supervisor end-point assessment. They understand how to lead people, manage individuals and teams, manage projects and build relationships with others. They know how to use emotional intelligence to communicate effectively when managing their team and ways to give clear support and guidance to achieve operational goals. They have knowledge of organisational financial processes, governance and budget management.

This person is self-aware, has strong communication skills and can build and maintain effective customer and colleague relationships. They are able to confidently lead people to achieve team objectives and manage day-to-day tasks within their team. They can apply problem solving techniques to make workplace decisions and implement projects to improve the work of their team. They share good practice with others and reflect on their own performance acting on the feedback that they receive.

This person demonstrates resilience and accountability. They take responsibility for managing difficult situations and actively seek the views of others. They are flexible to the needs of the organisation and are creative, innovative and enterprising when suggesting solutions to work challenges. They act in a professional manner by setting an example of inclusive behaviours such as trust, openness and authenticity.

04a304f0-3cb1-4502-a82b-e3baba1b4832.description: This apprenticeship is designed for middle managers such as Operations Manager, Regional Manager, Divisional Manager, Department Manager and other specialist managers who work in the private, public or third sector. The qualification is suitable for middle managers in all sizes of organisation with operational/project responsibilities or responsibility for managing a team to deliver a clearly defined outcome. (IFATE Standard Reference Number: ST0385 and ILM Qualification Number 9309-12)
04a304f0-3cb1-4502-a82b-e3baba1b4832.name: 9309-12 Level 5 Operations / Departmental Manager - Distinction

badge_template_activities.title: This person has met the distinction grade for the Level 5 Operations/Departmental Manager end-point assessment. They understand operational management approaches and models, project management tools/techniques and business finance. They know how to motivate and improve performance to build high performing teams. They understand networking and the impact that different leadership styles and emotional intelligence have on individuals and teams.

This person is able to input into strategic planning, set and manage budgets, and implement projects to deliver required organisational outcomes. They communicate organisational vision/goals and can motive team members by identifying their strengths and development areas. They use a range of communication techniques to negotiate, influence and manage conflict. They are able to reflect on their own performance and create personal development plans to implement performance improvements.

This person has the drive to achieve in all aspects of work and is determined when managing difficult situations by taking a fair approach in line with organisational values. They are an authentic leader and build trust in their teams by seeking the views of others. They are agile in their approach to management, open to new ways of working and role model inclusive behaviour.

b36e0150-8d30-4601-875c-36977ef55238.description: This Diploma is designed for individuals who manage teams (or projects) and are responsible for achieving operational or departmental goals and objectives as part of organisational strategy. The qualification aligns to the ‘on programme’ elements of the Operations/Departmental Manager Apprenticeship Standard. (Ofqual Qualification Number 603/1167/8 and ILM Qualification Number 8420)
b36e0150-8d30-4601-875c-36977ef55238.name: Level 5 Diploma for Leaders and Managers - 8420-01

badge_template_activities.title: This person has developed knowledge of leadership theories, team dynamics, building relationships with colleagues and customers, effective workplace communication techniques, project management tools, problem solving approaches, decision making techniques, budget management, time management tips, developing emotional intelligence and raising self-awareness.

This person can set goals and targets for their team, monitor task progress, communicate effectively, develop and support individuals, plan and run meetings, review team and individual performance, produce management reports, plan and implement a project, identify and solve problems, make decisions, build relationship across an organisation and  review their own leadership practice.

0f2d6b7c-ba94-49bc-b442-0e2f7df917c2.description: This qualification is for professional coaches at an executive or senior level to gain further knowledge and skills. It is suitable for senior managers or Human Resources/Organisation Development professionals who wish to develop their expertise and credibility in the fields of Executive and Senior level coaching and mentoring, or to establish a coaching culture at an organisational level. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3762/X and ILM Qualification Number 8589-21)
0f2d6b7c-ba94-49bc-b442-0e2f7df917c2.name: Level 7 Certificate for Executive and Senior Level Coaches and Mentors (8589-21)

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose of coaching and mentoring within an organisational context and can develop strategies to overcome organisational barriers to coaching. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values that an effective coach or mentor requires and the need to manage relationships ethically.

This person can apply a range of coaching models to coach others and is able to explore the expectations and boundaries of their stakeholders. They can establish and build effective coaching or mentoring relationships with clients at a senior/strategic level. They can review clients’ development needs and progress towards achieving their goals, maintaining relevant records in line with organisational requirements.

This person has undertaken at least 52 hours effective coaching or mentoring at an executive or senior level. They can reflect on all coaching or mentoring activity, feedback and supervision to reach conclusions about their own performance.

2f955013-3a5c-455c-838c-f75bb3b1523f.description: The Level 4 Certificate in Leadership and Management is designed for new and aspiring middle managers. This qualification helps learners Consolidate management skills and experience, build knowledge of specialist business areas such as finance and marketing, develop the capabilities and personal awareness you need to be a leader and accredit your experience with nationally recognised qualifications. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5932/1 and ILM Qualification Number 8605-21)
2f955013-3a5c-455c-838c-f75bb3b1523f.name: Level 4 Certificate in Leadership & Management - 8605-21

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully completed all components of the qualification and developed knowledge and skills in seven or more optional topic areas such as planning work, presentations, giving briefings, motivating others, developing self, discipline, recruitment, staff induction, training, coaching, quality management, delegating, leading meetings, marketing, developing relationships, mentoring and mental health.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include problem solving, innovation, change, creativity, customer service, business writing, contract management, incident management, security, service operations, environmental issues, procurement, project management, health and safety, performance management, budgeting, resource efficiency, conflict management, stress management, negotiation, networking,  information systems and  managing remote workers.

70b4c836-1a75-458c-a215-2d6aaa80e334.description: This qualification is designed for new and aspiring middle managers seeking a thorough grounding in their role and responsibilities, plus the opportunity to consolidate and further develop the key skills and knowledge they need at this level. 70b4c836-1a75-458c-a215-2d6aaa80e334.name: Level 5 Diploma in Principles of Leadership and Management - 8610-31

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: 1. Understand the specific responsibilities of middle managers in enabling an organisation to achieve its goals  2.  Understand how communication and interpersonal skills affect managerial performance in the workplace 3. Assess personal development opportunities to improve own managerial performance

This person is able to 1. Understand the effectiveness of the organisation and own ability to manage and improve quality to meet customer requirements 2.  plan and implement projects to meet, and if possible exceed, customer requirements
This person is able to : 1. Understand financial concepts used to inform management decisions. 2. Be able to make a financial case to inform a management decision
This person is able to 1. critically assess own beliefs, attitudes and value systems 2. critically assess the validity of management theories in relation to own beliefs, attitudes and values
This person is able to :  1. Understand the need for innovation and change management within an organisation  2.  Propose innovative solutions to improve organisational performance
This person has completed a range of optional units that enabled them to demonstrate a broad range of core and specialist topics that best fit their individual and organisational requirements.
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual in England and Northern Ireland

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to:
1. Understand the principles supporting leadership and management
2. Engage and inspire stakeholders and colleagues
3. Deliver results
4. Understand the principles of strategic planning
5. Analyse the factors affecting the development of strategic plans
6. Contribute to a strategic plan
7. Understand techniques and tools that support the design of business processes
8. Develop business processes
9. Evaluate the effectiveness of business processes
10. Understand the management and evaluation of change

12. Manage strategic change

8181baaa-772c-42f3-b24c-50de543b409c.description: This qualification is for those who wish to gain the knowledge, skills and confidence to effectively coach people within an organisational context. They are ideal for both new and existing coaches. This also an ideal qualification for those who wish to commence a career in coaching. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3732/1 and ILM Qualification Number 8585-11)
8181baaa-772c-42f3-b24c-50de543b409c.name: Level 3 Award in Effective Coaching - 8585-11

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands good practice when coaching individuals in the workplace. They know the roles, responsibilities, behaviours and characteristics of an effective coach. They understand the contracting process and how to manage confidentiality to coach ethically.

This person is able to manage a coaching process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support effective coaching by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They can maintain records and are able to recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching at work.

This person has undertaken at least six hours of effective coaching of others in an organisational environment. They can assess their own abilities as a coach, including reflecting on their communication and interpersonal skills when coaching. They are also able to draw conclusions about their performance and plan for future development needs.

The Award looks at team roles, what makes a team work well, and how to build relationships and deal with conflict in the team. This person is self-aware, has strong communication skills and is able to build and maintain effective customer and colleague relationships. This person demonstrates resilience and accountability. They take responsibility for managing difficult situations and actively seek the views of others. They are flexible to the needs of the organisation and are creative, innovative and enterprising when suggesting solutions to work challenges. They act in a professional manner by setting an example of inclusive behaviours such as trust, openness and authenticity.

This person can manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support executive coaching or mentoring by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They maintain records and can recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

This person has completed the following mandatory units: Understanding the Context of Coaching and Mentoring in a Strategic Business Environment, Undertaking Coaching or Mentoring at a Senior and Strategic Level & Reflecting on Your Own Ability to Perform Effectively as a Coach or Mentor Practising at a Senior Level

They understand financial strategies and the associated governance and legal requirements. They are aware of organisational dynamics and how to build engagement.

This person is enterprising and can deliver high performance strategies that focus on growth/sustainability. They can initiate and lead change using inspirational communication. They drive a culture of resilience and can manage risk. They enable high performing teams and manage relationships across diverse stakeholders. They can influence, negotiate and use advocacy skills to build organisational reputation.

This person has high levels of self-awareness and leads by example. They enable empowerment in their teams and champion cultural inclusion. They are confident and brave, willing to seek new ideas and innovate. They take personal accountability that are aligned to values and instill confidence in others. They reflect on their own performance and advocate the use of good practice internally and externally.

They know how to motivate and improve performance to build high performing teams. They understand networking and the impact that different leadership styles and emotional intelligence have on individuals and teams.

This person can input into strategic planning, set and manage budgets, and implement projects to deliver required organisational outcomes. They can communicate organisational vision/goals and motive their team members by identifying their strengths and development areas. They can use a range of communication techniques to negotiate, influence and manage conflict. They are able to reflect on their own performance and create personal development plans to implement performance improvements.

This person has the drive to achieve in all aspects of work and is determined when managing difficult situations by taking a fair approach in line with organisational values. They are an authentic leader and build trust in their teams by seeking the views of others. They are agile in their approach to management, open to new ways of working and role model inclusive behaviour.

6fd5a0bd-223b-4c37-97a1-13de02ad9028.description: This qualification is for those who wish to develop the knowledge, skills and confidence required to mentor people. 6fd5a0bd-223b-4c37-97a1-13de02ad9028.name: Level 2 Award in Effective Mentoring Skills - 8584-11

They have developed understanding of the role and nature of mentoring, and some mentoring models that can be used. They have understood how to organise mentoring activities and plan for effective 1:1 mentoring sessions.

This person has undertaken at least 3 hours of effective mentoring in an organisation or on a voluntary basis. They have used mentoring skills to practice key listening and questioning techniques. They have reflected on their own performance, then defined goals, progress and actions required to improve their mentoring practice.

f1558801-c85b-4a62-8aff-a81bcf0bd39d.description: The Network Rail Leader programme is specifically aimed at front line leaders and delivers a highly practical experiential learning experience aligned to the needs of Network Rail diverse corporate operational requirements. Facilitated group discussion and experiential learning exercises together with personal review of an individual psychometric profile, enables and informs reflective and reflexive learning, to develop both current and future leadership capability.
f1558801-c85b-4a62-8aff-a81bcf0bd39d.name: NETWORK RAIL LEADER

badge_template_activities.title: Through completion of the Network Rail Leader programme the individual has demonstrated proactivity, optimism, resilience, emotional intelligence, stress management and improved awareness of personal impact and alignment with organisational core values, behavioural frameworks and strategic vision.

Throughout the programme this individual has developed and applied their leadership skills in applicable practical activities, business relevant scenarios, group discussion and ongoing self-reflection.
This individual has completed an immersion event where they successfully applied their learning and actively demonstrated professional and commercial behaviors in a challenging business simulation.

5d9c7b5d-21ae-46eb-9163-616e9a566cb6.description: The programme aims to deliver the best onboarding experience for new Team Managers offering a supported programme of blended content ensuring all Team Managers are ‘set up for success’. They are supported through the soft skills required to be an effective leader, the behaviours expected and the HR policies and operating procedures needing to be followed. Content will be delivered in a blended way using distance learning, e-learning, facilitated learning and on the job learning.
5d9c7b5d-21ae-46eb-9163-616e9a566cb6.name: Programme for Team Managers

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will have completed aspects of the programme in a formal classroom environment with self-study and blended learning. It will have been delivered in-house using a virtual classroom as the facilitation platform with delivery of distance learning and e-learning. The content covers: Understanding Your Role as a Leader, Developing High Performing Teams, Effective Communications, Coaching Skills.

Participants will have completed a programme of professional experience: On the Job accreditation proving competence in elements of the role having the greatest impact; Leadership Culture Framework covering the organisation’s behavioural standards; Development Centre resulting in completion of a PDP document to track progress against the required standard; Advisor sentiment survey with those reporting directly rating the manager with additional rating from their programme advisors.

5f89c363-49e4-4e0b-b959-c5dfb62bd3f7.description: This programme enables participants to rise to the leadership challenge. Participants are guided from leading micro issues such as self-realisation and developing high performance team to macro topics like leading the function and organisation in the volatility, uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity of business conditions and situations.
5f89c363-49e4-4e0b-b959-c5dfb62bd3f7.name: Assured Certificate in Leadership & People Management

badge_template_activities.title: This individual completed a case study to using ability to assess leadership capabilities, to develop own and other leadership talents, understand and motivating and communicate within teams, develop coaching skills and use effective coaching techniques to improve staff performance, develop high performance team, lead organisation change, use systematic problem-solving and decision-making approach and formulating and implementing leadership strategies effectively.

6a99aa4e-afda-4d67-a0b2-e23d52bad71a.description: This qualification is designed for practicing team leaders, to help them become more effective and confident in their leadership role. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5962/X and ILM Qualification Number 8000-25)

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include self-development, self-management, understanding change, workplace communication methods, providing quality to customers, meeting customer requirements, solving problems, health and safety, diversity, business improvement techniques, enterprise awareness, legal requirements, using data, waste management and sales.

badge_template_activities.title: This organisation has achieved the required standards to become ILM Recognised and programmes align to the following measures of quality:

Suitable for learners 16 years old, or over. Accreditation No: 600/2260/7 Qualification Code (ILM only) 8322-90
bbcae899-6c70-4956-9966-498eb49f1283.name: Level 5 Certificate in Leadership - 8322-90

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: 1. Understand leadership styles within an organisation 2. Be able to review effectiveness of own leadership capability and performance in meeting organisational values and goals.  3. Be able to adopt an effective leadership style to motivate staff to achieve organisational values and goals.
This person is able to: 1. Use action learning for leadership development 2. Be able to plan and undertake activities to develop own leadership performance
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual in England and Northern Ireland

skills.name: Applying Different Leadership Styles In A Range Of Situations
Understand The Impact Of Prevailing Leadership Tyles

6c70ef98-ba70-42fa-a43e-4d8566170f9f.description: This apprenticeship is designed for managers who are responsible for overseeing people, projects and operations delivering long term organisational success. They are typically able to deliver impact combined with commitment to continual learning and development to achieve the professional recognition of their ability. (IFATE Standard Reference Number: ST0272 and ILM Reference 9310)
6c70ef98-ba70-42fa-a43e-4d8566170f9f.name: 9310-12 Level 6 Chartered Manager Degree - Merit

badge_template_activities.title: This person seeks new opportunities using commercial acumen and They have the drive to achieve in all aspects of work and are flexible to the needs of the organisation. They take a fair and ethical approach to leadership in line with organisational values. They lead authentically and seek the views of others, valuing diversity in their teams. They are agile in their approach to management and are innovative and enterprising when seeking solutions to business needs.

This person can set targets, develop strategic plans, produce financial reports, make ethical decisions and drive organisational change. They can communicate clearly and lead people by articulating the organisational purpose and values. They build rapport and trust to engage and empower teams. They can reflect on their own performance, are self-aware and develop themselves professionally.

This person has met the merit grade for the Level 6 Chartered Manager Degree end-point assessment. They understand how to develop operational strategy, project management models and business financial management approaches. They know how to create marketing strategies and the digital technologies impact on their organisation. They understand inclusive leadership styles, how to build stakeholder relationships and how to recruit, manage and develop people.

bd7e1a5e-28df-4b0a-8078-242092a93b47.description: This apprenticeship is for people with senior management responsibility. They are responsible for providing a clear purpose to deliver results, driving strategic intent and identifying longer-term opportunities and risks. They are responsible for developing ethical, innovative and supportive cultures. (IFATE Standard Reference Number: ST0480 and ILM Reference 9311)
bd7e1a5e-28df-4b0a-8078-242092a93b47.name: 9311-12 Level 7 Senior Leader Masters Degree - Pass

badge_template_activities.title: This person has met the pass grade for the Level 7 Senior Leader Master's Degree end-point assessment. They understand organisational strategy and how to shape the vision, culture and values. They understand the drivers for change and how to innovate. They know the risks associated with their business and how these can be managed. They understand financial strategies and the associated governance and legal requirements. They are aware of organisational dynamics and how to build engagement.

This person is enterprising and can deliver high performance strategies that focus on growth/sustainability. They can initiate and lead change using inspirational communication. They drive a culture of resilience and can manage risk. They enable high performing teams and manage relationships across diverse stakeholders. They can influence, negotiate and use advocacy skills to build organisational reputation.

This person has high levels of self-awareness and leads by example. They enable empowerment in their teams and champion cultural inclusion. They are confident and brave, willing to seek new ideas and innovate. They take personal accountability that are aligned to values and instill confidence in others. They reflect on their own performance and advocate the use of good practice internally and externally.

b79ade74-60bf-458d-87e2-9cf59aba2da2.description: Entrepreneurs' International Coach and Mentor training program is an ILM recognized programme of learning, created, and delivered by Sabri Investments for supporting trainers and mentors in action. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by enabling coaches and mentors to use international skills to deliver their mentoring and coaching sessions.
b79ade74-60bf-458d-87e2-9cf59aba2da2.name: Entrepreneurs' International Coach and Mentor - Sabri Investments

badge_template_activities.title: Understand coaching principles, and tools to guide entrepreneurs towards successful projects.
Understand mentoring principles, and tools to guide entrepreneurs towards successful projects.

d5431906-5132-4cb0-b7c3-a520fe4dfbbf.name: Paladone Intermediate Leadership Programme

The sessions involved group activities to embed the knowledge gained, with post workshop reflection on application of gained knowledge

Business performance to date.
The ILM 3 year growth plan.
The new ILM brand, visual identity and values.
The ILM product framework and roll-out plan.
Market and digital strategy.
Introduction of Honest Conversations performance management.

b8c0a278-f060-4ead-a2ea-69f335fd6ec2.description: Management Fundamentals is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created & delivered by Byron Business Solutions for Gardline managers. The programme develops knowledge, skills & techniques by providing a blend of practical bespoke training workshops & individual practical workplace application activities, with the aim of immediately applying sound theory to real leadership & management challenges. You develop a range of practical skills & methods to be a great manager & leader.

The delegate can employ their own individual and flexible leadership and management styles for different individuals and teams
The delegate has developed interpersonal skills and strategies to motivate and improve their team.

The delegate can appreciate understand and demonstrate change leadership utilising agility, practical techniques and skills to lead and manage individuals and teams through changes within the workplace

b0bf5051-4ca2-4ed1-b30e-5412d6f001f4.description: Master Trainer is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Growship for Emerging trainers. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by Assessment, Micro learning, Training, Coaching and Action Plan.

Know how to deal with different type of learners.
Understand learning objectives tools. Understand the ADDIE model. Define instruction method. Define the course outlines.
Design and develop training material. Deliver the training program. Measure the learning impact.

This individual understands accountability and responsibility, coaching and assessment and professional relationships
7c5dbe13-09fb-4a1c-bcc1-7df5cc35015a.name: Facilitating Learning in Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Completed a learning programme assured by ILM
Passed a formal assessment as part of the learning programme

7658f474-985c-4bfc-937f-156f8f54023b.description: First Steps in Management is an ILM Recognised programme of learning and assessment, created and delivered by Praeceptor Consulting for staff starting on their management journey. It is specifically aimed at NHS healthcare staff working in bands 2-5. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by building on existing skills, increasing self-awareness and confidence and developing an understanding of working with people.
7658f474-985c-4bfc-937f-156f8f54023b.name: First Steps in Management - Praeceptor Consulting

badge_template_activities.title: Developing self – This individual has developed self-awareness of their own strengths and areas for improvement. They have developed skills in analysing appropriate learning opportunities and setting SMART personal development objectives for self and others.

Emotional Intelligence - EI - This individual has developed an understanding of Emotional Intelligence (EI). They have an awareness of their own EI and have gained knowledge of different techniques to maximise EI and its impact on relationships with others.

Team dynamics – This individual has developed an understanding of team dynamics including the lifecycle of a team and the benefits and challenges of working with others. They also have an awareness of team role preferences and establishing team rules.
This individual has completed an assessment that confirmed their knowledge and skills in their own First Steps in Management journey.

0e8dca7c-16c6-4301-86cd-79a6c8fb751d.description: As part of its mission, the UK Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) is working in partnership with the Government of Kenya to support the continuous professional development of its national police and prisons service, prosecutions and judiciary. Completing relevant coursework in a formal classroom environment over a total of 15 days, supplemented with self-study and the completion of an associated workbook.

Preparing and maintaining a portfolio of professional evidence against the published criteria including CV; Evidence Booklet; Lesson Plans; Handouts; Self-Assessments; Tutor Assessments; Peer Assessments; a SWOT Analysis; and other supplementary evidence, supported by all relevant Literature Material

The programme enhances knowledge, skills and attitude in a variety of areas. These include planning and organizing work activities, resolving construction work related issues, leading work groups, evaluating work group accomplishments and maintaining quality, environmental, health & safety, and company policy compliance.
f4f0f39c-b4e2-40ff-97ca-5a581eedb882.name: Construction Site Supervisor

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed a number of discrete formative and summative assessments, including a written examination, observation of practical skills, portfolio with professional discussion, case study development, knowledge assessments and a report production.

The earner has completed a 16-day course comprising plenary discussions, demonstrations, self-study, apprenticeship, observed practical demonstration, structured experiential activities, case studies and professional discussions.

74931e8c-e039-4909-ab92-dc49edcf5770.description: Discovering Leadership is First Central Insurance & Technology Group’s development programme for aspiring leaders who have the desire and potential to lead others. Participants develop a strong understanding of leadership, giving them skills and confidence to support themselves and others and build a great support network for the future. To successfully complete Discovering Leadership, participants attended our modular training and demonstrated competence through a rigorous assessment process.
74931e8c-e039-4909-ab92-dc49edcf5770.name: Discovering Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: This individual attended a ‘Setting the Scene’ course which enabled them to: Explain their responsibilities in order to successfully complete Discovering Leadership, identify the key skills and behaviours that are required to be an effective leader, and recognise the difference between leadership and management

This individual attended a ‘Business Awareness’ course which enabled them to: Define their brand by identifying their core values, define how they can contribute to the company’s brand values, and explain the purpose of key departments within our business. Use all of this knowledge to support their networking and collaboration throughout the business

This individual attended an ‘Effective Communication’ course which enabled them to: Explain the key elements of communication and how to use them effectively, evaluate the impact of messages they and others deliver, and understand different communication styles for providing and receiving information

This individual attended a ‘Great Conversations and Coaching’ course to: Define the value of coaching to the business, the team and the individual, confidently explain the GROW coaching model, and perform a coaching session and agree actions to support a Coachee’s development

This individual participated in numerous events and activities to support their learning: In role learning by undertaking tasks associated with leaders e.g. coaching and providing feedback, and attended ‘Action Learning Sets’ with other participants and senior leaders within the business

At the end of this programme this individual completed assessments in the following areas: Powerful Feedback – demonstrating an ability to provide feedback in a challenging situation, and Great Conversations and Coaching – demonstrating through ‘role-play’ an ability to support the development of a colleague through a great coaching conversation

6a07989c-2a7e-4aa5-82b8-de86a5e6b26c.description: This qualification aims to provide the knowledge, skills and understanding to effectively coach or mentor others within an organisational context. It is suitable for managers and those with significant responsibility for coaching and mentoring as part of their daily role. It is also designed to develop individuals planning to move into a development role or start a career as a coach or mentor. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3758/8 and ILM Qualification Number 8588-24)
6a07989c-2a7e-4aa5-82b8-de86a5e6b26c.name: Level 5 Certificate in Effective Coaching and Mentoring - 8588-24

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved the Level 5 Certificate in Effective Coaching and Mentoring. They understand the purpose of coaching and mentoring in an organisational context and can explain the similarities and differences. They can present the case for the business benefits of coaching and mentoring. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values of an effective coach and mentor.

This person can manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support effective coaching or mentoring by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They maintain records and can recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

b23c371f-fff7-4bb1-93fe-8e3fa3f998db.description: This programme is designed to equip managers with the leadership skills and attributes that they need to lead and support resilient and creative teams going forward. The programme is for all managers across Tameside Council and Tameside & Glossop CCG, to ensure that the Organisation has a consistent way of leading, managing and supporting its workforce so they feel valued, empowered and engaged to do the very best job that they can.
b23c371f-fff7-4bb1-93fe-8e3fa3f998db.name: STRIVE Leadership & Management Development Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has completed a pre-course self-assessment and a review of their learning journey.
The individual has completed a wide range of interactive activities within each module.
Impact of the learning is evaluated 3 months post-course.

29123bc4-55d2-49a6-8c9b-52c26a78f0cb.description: Achieving Excellence is aimed at high performing individuals and is designed to build knowledge and confidence in management capability. The delegate has taken an active part in facilitated activities, formal sessions, experiential learning exercises and reflective learning. As a result, they have developed both current and future management capability.
29123bc4-55d2-49a6-8c9b-52c26a78f0cb.name: Achieving Excellence Talent Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The delegate has taken part in a range of interactive formal sessions to enhance knowledge and has demonstrated Learning techniques to make the right impact, build credibility and become an effective role model. They have enhanced personal and departmental performance by seeking feedback and acting on it.  They have learned to manage relationships across the business through effective communication and are able to take ownership for their work by planning and prioritising.
The delegate has throughout the programme developed and applied their management skills using relevant activities, organisation, real life scenarios, group discussions and ongoing self-reflection.
The delegate has completed all worksheets on time and to a satisfactory standard.

The delegate has completed a presentation to senior management where they have successfully applied their learning and skills by actively demonstrating professional and commercial behaviours in a challenging final activity.

83d46b9e-37ff-40e7-98e1-ea9051c2478c.description: This qualification provides professional coaches with the required supervisory knowledge and skills to practice as confident and competent coaching supervisors of coaches. It is suitable for those seeking to enhance and accredit their expertise in the coaching supervision of coaches with a nationally recognised qualification. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3766/7 and ILM Qualification Number 8590-21)
83d46b9e-37ff-40e7-98e1-ea9051c2478c.name: Level 7 Certificate for Coaching Supervisors - 8590-21

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose and ethical principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches and can critically compare different approaches for the effective coaching supervision of coaches. They have an understanding of the anticipated outcomes of effective coaching supervision for different stakeholders.

This person can support organisations to provide in-house coaching. They can plan, deliver and review the coaching supervision of coaches. They can develop coaches who are able to use the feedback from supervisory sessions to plan their own and others’ professional development.

This person has undertaken at least 20 hours effective coaching supervision. They can assess their own abilities as a supervisor of coaches. They are also able to reflect in a structured way and draw conclusions about their performance to plan for future development needs. They understand the principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches in practice and how to evaluate the overall benefits.

069f198d-fda3-4a0a-a5c8-8ca4daa7bf8d.description: The individual has attended a training session delivered by ILM International that covers; The qualities of leadership, The leader- roles & responsibilities, Differences & similarities between leadership & management, and the need for each of them, explored a range of at least 3 leadership models .
069f198d-fda3-4a0a-a5c8-8ca4daa7bf8d.name: Understanding Leadership - ILM International

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has attended an event either face to face or online that covers:
The qualities of leadership
The leader- roles & responsibilities
Differences & similarities between leadership & management, and the need for each of them
Range of at least 3 leadership models
Leadership Behaviours
To develop knowledge and understanding of leadership as required by a practising first line manager

a3f8adf9-1638-40e3-b301-30c6f4991a80.description: This qualification is designed for practicing team leaders, to help them become more effective and confident in their leadership role. The Award is also suitable for new or aspiring team leaders as it supports them to make the transition from working in a team to leading a team. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5928/X and ILM Qualification Number 8000-13)
a3f8adf9-1638-40e3-b301-30c6f4991a80.name: Level 2 Award in Leadership & Team Skills - 8000-13

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved the Level 2 Award in Leadership and Team Skills. They have developed their skills and knowledge from two or three optional topics which may include leading a team, setting team objectives, planning and monitoring work, improving team performance, developing a team, briefing a team, effective team working, working within organisational guidelines, using resources, employee induction and coaching.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include self-development, self-management, understanding change, workplace communication methods, providing quality to customers, meeting customer requirements, solving problems, health and safety, diversity, business improvement techniques, enterprise awareness, legal requirements, using data, waste management and sales.

7d73abf4-6a0c-482e-a910-5ee12f2b67b8.description: The Level 4 Award in Leadership and Management is designed for new and aspiring middle managers. This qualification helps learners Consolidate management skills and experience, build knowledge of specialist business areas such as finance and marketing, develop the capabilities and personal awareness you need to be a leader and accredit your experience with nationally recognised qualifications. Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5851/1 and ILM Qualification Number 8605-13)
7d73abf4-6a0c-482e-a910-5ee12f2b67b8.name: Level 4 Award in Leadership & Management (8605-13)

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include problem solving, innovation, change, creativity, customer service, business writing, contract management, incident management, security, service operations, environmental issues, procurement, project management, health and safety, performance management, budgeting, resource efficiency, conflict management, stress management, negotiation, networking,  information systems and  managing remote workers.

e5823d7b-3930-440c-ae73-55556b7600d7.description: This Diploma is designed for project managers, department heads, and other practising middle managers. The qualification helps people to develop a broad range of leadership skills and experience, improve personal performance and prepare for senior management responsibilities. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5856/0 and ILM Qualification Number 8607-32)
e5823d7b-3930-440c-ae73-55556b7600d7.name: Level 5 Diploma in Leadership & Management - 8607-32

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include resource management, recruitment, information management, work analysis, using statistics, facilities management, leading teams, giving presentations, lean methodologies, environmental performance, managing remote workers, partnership working, organisational governance, information management, coaching, mentoring, and managing mental health.

This person has developed additional knowledge and skills which may include leading a complex activity, equality and diversity, managing risk, delegating authority, developing people, developing leadership styles, financial management, health and safety, marketing, team motivation, problem solving,  change management, organisational culture, financial statements, budget planning, marketplace economics, mental toughness and operations research.

b6ae3014-501f-41ce-b591-2da2e26865f3.description: Workplace Excellence is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Career Nuggets Production, via The Academy, for professionals desiring management or leadership roles within their organisations. The programme seeks to develop knowledge and skills by running 7 modules that address vital soft skills required for career progression and development in the workplace such as Employability skills, Communication, Confidence and Conflict Management.
b6ae3014-501f-41ce-b591-2da2e26865f3.name: Career Nuggets – Workplace Excellence - Career Nuggets Production

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a personal development plan for leadership; demonstrate to current and prospective employers capabilities, ambition and commitment to professional development
Develop skills that would improve career prospects.
Develop tools, frameworks, and practices to help navigate workplace challenges, boost confidence in the workplace and further the ability to lead, negotiate and influence.

Learn how to communicate effectively (using written and spoken word, non-verbal language, electronic tools, and listening skills) to develop relationships, manage conflicts, and work across differences.
Develop better emotional Intelligence, explore and discover how to maintain a sense of personal balance.

4ad34580-a5c9-4e51-9d2b-b4c9ed65f628.description: This qualification is for professional coaches at an executive or senior level to gain further knowledge and skills. It is suitable for senior managers or Human Resources/Organisation Development professionals who wish to develop their expertise and credibility in the fields of Executive and Senior level coaching and mentoring, or to establish coaching at an organisational level. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3762/X and ILM Qualification Number 8589)
4ad34580-a5c9-4e51-9d2b-b4c9ed65f628.name: Level 7 Certificate for Executive and Senior Level Coaches and Mentors (8589-62)

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose of coaching and mentoring within an organisational context and can develop strategies to overcome organisational barriers to coaching. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values that an effective coach or mentor requires and the need to manage relationships ethically.

This person is able to apply a range of coaching models to coach others and is able to explore the expectations and boundaries of their stakeholders. They can establish and build effective coaching or mentoring relationships with clients at a senior/strategic level. They can review clients’ development needs and progress towards achieving their goals, maintaining relevant records in line with organisational requirements.
This person has undertaken at least 20 hours effective coaching. They can reflect on all coaching or mentoring activity, feedback and supervision to reach conclusions about their own performance.

652ae9fb-d637-4f1a-8a5d-ea472093578a.description: Intermediate Management is an ILM Recognised training programme - created and delivered by Stand & Deliver for Nippon Seiki (Europe) B.V. for managers to develop and enhance through management training to become and continue as more effective and confident managers within their role. It also supports managers to effectively manage their team. The programme develops and enhances robust knowledge and skills through a range of modules designed to interlink and build throughout the program

badge_template_activities.title: Leadership & Team Development: This module is for middlle managers with some experience of leading. It will look to enhance participants' current skills and successes and provide some new, more in-depth ideas, skills and concepts for you to bring to the role

Managing Change & Organisational Make-Up: Good leaders are able to exploit new opportunities, navigate through the ever-changing business needs and people needs, solving problems along the way. Whether responding to change or instigating it, this workshop will provide some tangible ways to work through change for both self and others

Problem Solving & Decision Making: This session explores the processes and practice of good problem solving and decision making. By understanding and using a variety of techniques participants will select the correct tools or framework for the task to generate and implement more effective decisions

Finance for Managers: This session will look at the basic elements of finance within business. It will provide delegates with an understanding of the main financial reports used to control a business together the KPIs which are derived from them to monitor performance

Developing and Maintaining a learning environment: This session explores the concept and practice of building and maintaining a learning culture within the team. Through this module participants will recognise the effectiveness and benefits of team colleagues thinking for themselves to enable them to start building a learning and coaching culture.

0ab4050a-e6df-4d6d-8596-b7283a6701ba.description: The programme is aimed at skilled and experienced Construction Trade and Site Supervisors. The PCA and PCA Foundation established the “Pambansang Treyner ng Konstruksyon” (National Trainer of Construction) Programme, from which this programme was initiated.
0ab4050a-e6df-4d6d-8596-b7283a6701ba.name: Construction Trade Supervisor and Site Supervisor – Train the Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed five discrete formative and summative assessments including: Induction for Trade Class, Mini Teaching for Trade Class, Induction for Site Class, Mini Teaching for Site Class and Simulation of Institutional Assessment.
The earner has completed an eight-day course comprising a series of lectures, videos, plenary, demonstrations and structured feedback, along with formal assessment of performance.

764535c5-82d1-4e6a-8fa3-f0831a9a8d06.description: ECTP Train the Trainer is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by TJS International for both new and current trainers worldwide. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by building confidence to develop and deliver highly effective, inspiring, and engaging classroom training, both face to face and virtually. The hands-on learning approach supports and guides the learner through a journey of skills practice with feedback every step of the way.
764535c5-82d1-4e6a-8fa3-f0831a9a8d06.name: Effective Communication for Training Professionals (ECTP Train the Trainer) - TJS International

badge_template_activities.title: By the end of this course you will be able to:

Facilitate interactive, memorable student-centred learning both face to face and via virtual classroom. This programme promotes student-centred learning and builds core skills so that learners can apply student-centred theory to the courses they teach. This is applied to both virtual classroom and face-to-face learning.

Communicate with confidence so your learners believe in you/you believe in yourself. Key aspects are the importance of first impressions, how to project confidence through verbal and non-verbal communication and the impact of body language. The differing use of verbal and non-verbal communication in face to face learning compared to virtual classroom is featured and the importance of planning promotes confidence in training.

Plan well-structured training that is easy for learners to follow as you give them a clear “road-map” and work to it. Well-structured training is a must – training does not succeed by accident. Therefore, the importance of preparation is a key focus on this programme as is clear structure in delivery, making it easy for learners to follow. This programme gives tips and templates on how to plan effectively and interpret course syllabi using a very hands-on approach to build confidence.

Engage learners every step of the way and check their understanding through advanced open question techniques. This programme focuses on how to keep your learners engaged from start to finish through advanced open question techniques and their importance in student-centred learning. Key skills are when and how to use open questions, when to use closed questions and how to handle answers effectively. This is practised in group activities.

Lead learning through effective use of teaching aids including making PPT interactive and stimulating. The use of PPT as a framework for the learning and the difference between this and presenting are studied and practised on this programme. The Kawasaki rule for PPT is promoted as are model techniques to make PPT interactive – in both face-to-face and virtual training. Through group activities learners will be able to evaluate how to use aids effectively for their own programmes.

8bee9f2e-1a51-4bfe-8adc-0b45e7655232.description: This credential represents the recipient can support customers shape their qualification offer

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands good practice when coaching individuals in the workplace. This person has undertaken at least six hours of effective coaching of others in an organisational environment. They can assess their own abilities as a coach, including reflecting on their communication and interpersonal skills when coaching. They are also able to draw conclusions about their performance and plan for future development needs.

4d0bb31d-d8fc-4ed1-a05c-b5f7bf7f1608.description: This qualification is designed for senior managers or HR/OD professionals who want to develop their expertise and credibility in the fields of coaching and mentoring, or to establish coaching on an organisational level. This person can manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They maintain records and can recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

badge_template_activities.title: What coaching really is and why it is such a crucial skill for the workplace Exploring the difference between coaching and other development interventions considering the what, how, by whom and the role of advice giving in the other interventions (mentoring, training, counselling). Exploring what coaching really is and why it works and looking at how it's use underpins an effective workplace.

How coaching can help you to better understand and get the best from yourself and how it can help you to find the right career direction Thinking about how coaching can help an individual as well as an organisation and how to use it to think about issues surrounding career direction.

The key skills for coaching and how to build and display them Exploring and putting into practice the GROW model and also the skills around 'creating focus', 'powerful questioning', 'active listening' and 'rapport building'.

How to confidently put the skills into practice with each other Putting all of the above in to practice over a number of occasions in the programme both in pairs and in an observed group practice session.

74f7af1b-4d0d-4759-8db8-643e1772db43.description: The bespoke 2-year blended programme is aimed at line managers to enable them to lead in an ethical, professional and highly effective way. It supports the embedding of the employer’s business vision and values and includes modern management, strengths-based coaching and communication skills. This is complemented by the latest developments in behavioural change, service excellence and emotional intelligence in the workplace.
74f7af1b-4d0d-4759-8db8-643e1772db43.name: Leadership and Behavioural Change Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has participated in a two-year programme designed for line managers of the future. They have completed four modules each consisting of group workshops and extensive embedding activities to facilitate the application of learning in role. They have been required to keep a continuous workplace journal and hold regular discussions with tutors and peers. The individual has successfully gained a blend of traditional and cutting-edge Leadership, Management and Behavioural Change skills.

The individual has successfully undergone independent external assessment for each of the four programme modules: Leading Yourself, Leading your Team, Leading your Business and Leading the Future. Assessment consisted of completing and meeting benchmark for ten embedding activities per module, supported by professional discussion, line manager and peer review, and observation of practice. Successful completion of all four modules within an agreed timescale was mandatory for full certification.

The individual has assembled a record of Leadership, Management & Behavioural Change performance evidence including: journal entries, demonstration of relevant subject knowledge and records of workplace performance in specific activities and skills. Evidence is peer and manager reviewed prior to formal assessment. The portfolio is a comprehensive record of the individual’s progress in the assimilation of a substantial set of Leadership and Management skills and behaviours.

The individual has demonstrated enhanced levels of emotional intelligence and an ability to lead behavioural change. Their appreciation of the way the mind works and the science behind this, has been tested and assessed to ensure they can apply the related learning to the way people think and behaviour in the workplace. The individual has demonstrated that they are able to lead in an open, ethical, inclusive and customer-centric way, where physical and mental well-being are key considerations.

af3fa509-b65f-4932-af4f-65b814c443ae.description: The UWSU Leadership Development Programme (LDP) is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by the University of Westminster Students’ Union (UWSU) for individuals in leadership roles. The programme aims to develop the required knowledge and skills to be an effective leader through the practical implementation of core leadership skills and practice obtained through ten key modules of learning that learners reflect upon and implement into their leadership style and practice.

badge_template_activities.title: Increased effectiveness of leadership: The ten modules are focused on key elements of effective leadership and therefore attendees will be able to focus on these and identify key improvement points to develop the effectiveness of their leadership style and capability.

A consistent approach to leadership: Through outlining organisational practices, procedures and expectations leadership consistency within the organisation will be improved and attendees will gain a clear understanding of key organisational leaderships tasks and processes.

Leadership confidence in the organisation: Through peer to peer support and line management reflective conversations after each module leaders will gain a clear understanding of strengths and weaknesses and therefore grow confidence in their leadership development.

Increased employability: Through completing the programme and achieving the recognised qualification the employability of the leader will be increased. It is expected that the programme will highlight further continued professional development needs that will boost employability.

Increased staff satisfaction and engagement: As a clear link exists between good leadership and management and staff satisfaction and engagement it is anticipated that the programme will have a positive impact on this area based upon the achievement of the previous learning objectives.

9331b886-1e4f-491c-bc4d-548651509f79.description: The UWSU Train The Trainer Programme is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by the University of Westminster Students’ Union (UWSU) for individuals in leadership roles wishing to enhance their training and presentation delivery skills. The programme aims to develop the required knowledge and skills to be an effective facilitator through the practical implementation and understanding of core training and development concepts and theory.
9331b886-1e4f-491c-bc4d-548651509f79.name: Train The Trainer - UWSU

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will understand the difference between education, training and development in order to allow them to formalise what the role of a trainer and facilitator is.
Participants will understand how individuals learn by studying the competency staircase and Kolb’s learning cycle and suggesting ways trainers use these theories to improve delivery.
Participants take an in-depth look into the theory of neuro-linguistic programming to aid knowledge on how to successfully write and deliver training session to a wide variety of learners.
Participants take an in-depth look at the communication cycle and possible barriers that can prevent communication being effective alongside the understanding of how to deliver accelerated learning.
Participants develop a clear knowledge of how to write, review and evaluate training sessions to continually develop the practice and quality of programmes delivered.

9a5dec8e-8b9b-4011-aba0-45cf33723ec2.description: The UWSU Finance Development Programme is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by the University of Westminster Students’ Union (UWSU) for individuals in leadership roles wishing to advance their financial management understanding and ability. The programme aims to develop the required knowledge and skills to enable leaders to be effective in the financial management of their departments and ensure appropriate resource management within their organisations.
9a5dec8e-8b9b-4011-aba0-45cf33723ec2.name: UWSU Finance Programme - UWSU

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will understand accounting terms and terminology and the two main financial reporting statements: the income statement (often called the ‘profit and loss account’) and the balance sheet.
Learners will understand the importance of financial reporting for managerial use and the role of accounting in how an organisation’s transactions are recorded and reported.

Learners will understand how to use financial ratios to measure financial performance. Learners will understand key financial ratios that help managers and leaders use to assess performance and identify some useful ratios for their organisation.

Learners explore a range of techniques and approaches that help managers and leaders assess the impact on costs of changing scenarios, as well as assess the implications of allocating overhead costs and how costs might change as decisions are taken.
Learners will understand the importance of cash and cash flow forecasts in financially managing an organisation alongside how forecasts are put together and reviewed.

badge_template_activities.title: This organisation has met the requirements for the following ILM Assured Benchmark Standards:

The organisation develops each programme to deliver against set objectives (Benchmark Standard 2)
The organisation ensures that participants on the programme are briefed and supported (Benchmark Standard 3)
The organisation has effective internal quality assurance procedures in place (Benchmark Standard 4)
The organisation has effective processes in place to ensure evaluation and continuous development (Benchmark Standard 5)

The organisation ensures that each leadership and management programme demonstrates the requirements for the ILM footprint: leadership, management, coaching, mentoring and enterprise (Benchmark Standard 6)
For assured programmes which have assessment included, the organisation has met the following Assured Benchmark Standard:
The organisation ensures that each programme with assessment has a robust assessment methodology and this is supported by effective quality procedures (Benchmark Standard 7)
For assured programmes which have digital learning included, the organisation has also met the following Benchmark Standard:
The organisation ensures that each programme with digital learning included is accessible, engaging and incorporates design standards in order to meet programme objectives (Benchmark Standard 8)

badge_template_activities.title: Confidence in setting up and running in-house ALS (action learning sets) : An understanding of the practicalities of setting up programmes of ALS e.g. suitable venues, ensuring accessibility etc. Appreciation of the challenges that can arise in in-house ALS e.g. conflicts between departments, need for participants to be peers, confidentiality. Ability to promote action learning internally and use language/style suitable for their context. Ability to design an appropriate recruitment process

Thorough understanding of the theories and practice of AL: Understanding the history of AL and its development since the founder Reg Revans. Confidence & experience of all the roles in the AL practice. presenter, set member, facilitator and receive facilitation feedback. Appreciation of how AL is built on Kolb's learning cycle and how it relates to other learning theories e.g. Honey & Mumford's learning style, Argyris & Schon's single and double loop learning, Senge's ladder of inference.

Ability to design an AL intervention to meet organisational needs: Clear understanding of action learning principles. Ability to clarify purpose of action learning work with the internal commissioner or sponsor. Ability to design an appropriate evaluation framework. Ability to present action learning in language that is appropriate for the organisational context

Ability to integrate AL into leadership, management and coaching programmes: Understanding of the range of action learning applications. Understanding of the core skills of action learning and how they relate to leadership, management and coaching. Ability to design an action learning intervention so that it meets organisational objectives

An understanding of when to use the different approaches of AL: Understanding of the range of action learning approaches e.g. peer consultancy, laser,action learning etc. Ability to recognise when to use the classic i.e Reg Revans model of action learning and when to adapt it. Ability to describe an alternative approach to participants
