badge_template_activities.title: The individual has attended several relevant professional events during their graduate programme, including department open days within the business as well as graduate experience exchange forums.  The individual has also attended various Graduate Careers Fairs to represent the business and the programme itself to future graduates.

The individual attended presentation skills training as part of their graduate programme. As part of this training, the individual developed their ability to create presentations that display information successfully. Similarly, they developed their ability to deliver oral presentations effectively.  The individual also delivered several presentations to both small and larger audiences in relation to both work for their department and projects assigned to them as part of the programme.

Scheduling was a significant part of the individual's responsibilities during the programme. The individual was required to schedule meetings with their mentor (a Director) in order to cultivate and maintain their mentorship.  Similarly, the individual also scheduled meetings with other individuals on the graduate programme in order to organise and complete a fundraising project with the business's charity partner. The individual also scheduled several events as part of this fundraising project.

The individual completed several projects. During operational training, the individual designed, implemented, and evaluated an operations project related to their programme stream. They presented the project to a team of Senior Managers.  In conjunction with others on the graduate programme, the individual developed a fundraising project for Lidl's charity partner. This involved the individual and the Graduate team devising, organising, and executing several fundraising events.

The individual attended work during their operational training and office placements each day on time and conducted themselves in a professional manner.  The individual also participated in several rotations within teams of their relevant stream's department.

Upon commencement of the programme, the individual read and agreed to the business's Employee Handbook which contains the business's conduct policies and procedures. The individual was required to sign a form to acknowledge that they had read and understood the content of the policy.

The individual attended several courses as part of their programme. These courses include Insights, First Steps of Leadership, Communication Workshop, Project Management Training, and Presentation Skill Training.

The individual developed several leadership skills over the course of their programme. As part of the programme, they attended leadership development courses including an Insights day to identify their style of leadership, a communication course and a leadership development programme.

This person has completed three of the following five optional units:

Unit 301: This person is able to: 1. Understand how to plan work on site; 2. Know how to put team members to work; 3. Understand how to improve the performance of a team in delivering to plan; 4. Understand the importance of quality management within the workplace

Unit 400: This person is able to: 1. Ability to build correct relationships with trainees, ice-breaking at the beginning of training, and be able to conduct partial or total training closing, and create a decent mental impression.

Ability to employ techniques in virtual training in terms of asking questions and surveys effectively, to stimulate interaction, follow-up and understanding of the trainees. Ability to master the body language and sound tone of voice to communicate instantly with the trainees. Ability to bring about change to the trainees in terms of skills and attitudes, in addition to knowledge and distinction in linking lectures, measuring strengthening the trainer and trainees with the sense of confidence.

d7430ed2-71e8-4924-b978-74c674b2ece9.description: Sustainability Leadership and Social Responsibility is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by GLOMACS, that brings opportunities to the organisations in the shape of continuous improvement, sustained competitive advantage, and long-term success. Be able to list ways to promote sustainability and CSV in organisations.

7d8cee10-1af1-494e-9ec9-46f1b146d86e.description: The holder of this credential has completed a leadership and management programme by Focus Management Consultancy. Completed a learning programme which is approved as ‘ILM Recognised’

3d465d73-91bc-439d-8d02-017ed0d63123.description: Understanding Emotional Intelligence is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Spearhead Gulf LLC (Spearhead Training). This programme helps understand the different aspects of human behaviour, and what emotional intelligence means. The delegates will learn how to build strong, open and honest relationships by being able to communicate with others based on understanding of their emotions, which will have an impact on their performance.
3d465d73-91bc-439d-8d02-017ed0d63123.name: Understanding Emotional Intelligence - Spearhead Gulf LLC

badge_template_activities.title: Greater control of your emotions, and therefore, your communication style Greater control of your emotions, and therefore, your communication style
Greater understanding of others' feelings, and the ability to lead successfully
Improved relationships in your personal and professional life through greater Emotional Intelligence
Lower levels of stress as a result of better understanding of your emotions and those of others
Increased self-motivation and a goal-oriented mindset & the ability to develop and apply Emotional Intelligence back in the workplace

41b869d6-b373-4517-b970-d1d7337d883c.description: Win-Win Negotiations Skills is an ILM Recognized programme of learning, created and delivered by Meirc Training & Consulting for executives, managers, professionals, salespeople, entrepreneurs, customer service representative. 2e476541-341d-46ca-8c7c-7dd40feb48c9.description: This qualification is for those who wish to gain the knowledge, skills and confidence to effectively coach people within an organisational context. This person is able to manage a coaching process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support effective coaching by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They can maintain records and are able to recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching at work.

They can assess their own abilities as a coach, including reflecting on their communication and interpersonal skills when coaching. a87dbaa1-a730-4435-88e1-3e45de4c5c9f.description: This qualification is aimed at sub-contractors, gangers, foreman, team leaders, supervisors, site managers and anyone requiring a thorough understanding of management and leadership principles to effectively lead, supervise and safely manage people across the many different industry sub sectors within the expanding built environment and construction industry. a87dbaa1-a730-4435-88e1-3e45de4c5c9f.name: Level 3 Certificate in L&M for the Construction & Built Environment (Nuclear Safety Pathway) – 8626-21

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: 1. Understand the roles and responsibilities of a site supervisor or team leader; 2. Understand the differences between leadership and management and the relationship between the two; 3.  Understand the role of quality management in site management; 4. Understand the importance of health and safety in site management

5. Understand current developments in the tunnelling industry in the UK;  6.  Understand the basics of tunnelling techniques and logistics; 7. Understand the safety and local environmental impacts of tunnelling projects; 8. Understand how to establish an effective team through developing working relationships and communication skills
This person has completed three of the following five optional units:

Unit 301: This person is able to: 1. Understand how to plan work on site; 2. Know how to put team members to work; 3.  Understand how to improve the performance of a team in delivering to plan; 4. Understand the importance of quality management within the workplace

Unit 302: This person is able to: 1.  Understand the importance of stakeholder relationships in making an organisation successful; 2. Understand the role of the supervisor in meeting client requirements; 3.  Understand the role of the supervisor in managing and controlling costs;  4.  Understand the role of the supervisor in minimising waste in an organisation; 5. Understand how keeping records contributes to making an organisation successful

Unit 303: This person is able to: 1. Understand how to use assessment and active listening and feedback to manage the performance of team members on site; 2. Understand how to manage poor performance and discipline of team members on site; 3. Understand how to manage conflict on site; 4. Understand how to identify and manage work-related stress; 5.  Understand how to manage a diverse workforce

Unit 304: This person is able to: 1. Understand site planning and programme requirements in order to lead and manage people and activities; 2. Understand the impact of managing resources, time and materials on the plan and programme; 3. Understand different work methods and their impact on quality, health and safety and the achievement of plans; 4. Understand how to leverage their leadership and management skills to achieve plan and programme milestones

Unit 305: This person is able to: 1. Understand how their personal leadership style affects the performance of others; 2. Understand how to establish and maintain an effective team; 3. Motivate the team to improve productivity; 4. Understand the importance of communication to team and site performance; 5. Understand the importance of feedback to individual and team performance;
6. apply a recognised coaching technique to develop and improve the performance of team members; 7. Understand how to persuade and influence others to achieve objectives

Unit 400: This person is able to: 1.  Understand how to identify the skills gap between existing and future knowledge and skill requirements; 2.  Understand how personal attributes and behaviour affect leadership and management performance; 3. Implement and monitor a personal development plan to meet an identified skills gap and areas for personal development
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual in England and Northern Ireland

badge_template_activities.title: The holder of this credential has:
Completed a learning programme which is approved as ‘ILM Recognised’.

cb49199c-dae9-401f-9dbc-575dd3a2dc03.description: The Customer Service Leadership Training Programme is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Beyond Theory for managers and team leaders. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by equipping managers and team leaders with the knowledge and skills they need to engage and motivate their teams to deliver highest levels of customer service.
cb49199c-dae9-401f-9dbc-575dd3a2dc03.name: Customer Service Leadership - Beyond Theory

alignments.name: Standard
alignments.description: The programme falls within the ILM Footprint of Leadership, Management, Coaching, Mentoring and Enterprise. It is well structured with appropriate governance and management to deliver consistently high-quality learning outcomes and objectives. Learners are fully supported and receive recognition for their achievement.

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will identify their preferred leadership style(s) and learn how to apply the most effective leadership style to engage and motivate their team members.

Learners will identify their motivational values and understand how these impact their behaviours, discover their strengths and overdone strengths at work and how their behaviour changes when faced with conflict.

Learners will be able to manage the performance of team members with the framework of UK law to improve and maintain performance. This includes providing feedback effectively and knowing when to provide training, coaching, counselling or disciplinary procedures.
Learners will be able to coach their team members to improve individual and team performance using the GROW coaching process and associated interpersonal skills.

Learners will be able to understand the key principles of delivering customer excellence, map their customer journey and design their service standards for their team to deliver the very best customer experience.

d88d15e1-e927-44e7-b32b-03eda4948cfa.description: Customer Service Manager is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Informa Middle East for Executives, managers and decision-makers who want to improve service performance by taking their customers to higher levels of satisfaction. It also gives customer service managers and supervisors advanced CS tools. The course aims to develop knowledge and skills by using interactive activities, group and individual exercises, case studies, video clips and training games.
d88d15e1-e927-44e7-b32b-03eda4948cfa.name: Customer Service Manager - Informa Middle East for Executives

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:
Learned to deliver service excellence face to face, via email and over the telephone.
Demonstrated how to handle complaints for an excellent outcome.
Turned a complaining customer into a happy loyal customer advocate.
Set goals, objectives, SLAs and KPIs monitoring to ensure service excellence is maintained.
Comprehended how personalities and behaviours can affect service.

8711d944-1854-4456-b391-c37214e3df6c.description: Customer Service is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Select Training and Management Consultancy for professionals in customer-related role who would like to develop a culture of service excellence. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by recognising and comprehending the customers.
8711d944-1854-4456-b391-c37214e3df6c.name: Customer Service - Select Training and Management Consultancy

badge_template_activities.title: Gained extensive knowledge of their clients and learned how to consistently outperform expectations.
Learned how to apply their knowledge in the workplace to foster a culture of excellence in customer service.
Acquired skills in gaining commitment from staff to adopt the new culture.
Mastered skills in empowering and motivating staff to focus in customers.
Developed competence in identifying perception points.

611f490e-6208-4f1c-b653-3842e8963ed2.description: Decision Making and Problem Solving is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Khimji Training Institute for leaders and team leaders . This experiential workshop will help the participants in various styles of thinking such as analytical, critical, creative and innovative thinking and its application in decision making and problem solving.
611f490e-6208-4f1c-b653-3842e8963ed2.name: Decision Making - Khimji Training Institute

badge_template_activities.title: The learners will be able to Identify problems and types.
The learners will understand the problem solving process and model.
The learners will be able to understand Individual and team behaviour when solving problems in a group.
The learners will understand the role of creativity when faced with challenges.
The learners will learn to use structured tools and techniques for solving problems.

f2a86237-c81e-4e67-b8e9-af1c7d6dba4f.description: The programme aims at newly recruited Deputy Team Leaders (classed as a developmental role within the business) who aspire to a Team Manager position. The programme aims to deliver the best onboarding experience supporting them through the soft skills required to be an effective leader, the behaviours expected and the HR policies and operating procedures needing to be followed. Content will be delivered in a blended way using distance learning, on-the-job and e-learning, facilitated learning
f2a86237-c81e-4e67-b8e9-af1c7d6dba4f.name: Deputy Team Leader Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will have completed aspects of the programme in a formal classroom environment with self-study and blended learning. It will have been delivered in-house using a virtual classroom as the facilitation platform with delivery of distance learning and e-learning. The content covers: Understanding Your Role as a Leader, Developing High Performing Teams, Effective Communications, Coaching Skills.

Participants will have completed a programme of professional experience: On the Job accreditation proving competence in elements of the role having the greatest impact; Leadership Culture Framework covering the organisation’s behavioural standards; Development Centre resulting in completion of a PDP document to track progress against the required standard; Advisor sentiment survey with those reporting directly rating the manager with additional rating from their programme advisors.

ab358fe7-7f0b-49d8-b0b8-9f0fd0df8303.description: The holder of this credential has completed a leadership and management programme by Focus Management Consultancy. A clear understanding of how to manage individuals, groups, and tasks, more effectively

badge_template_activities.title: The delegate has gained a greater appreciation of individual difference and, using a personal profiling tool, has increased self-awareness and improved ability to recognise mindset, beliefs and strengths that improve communication and leadership.

The delegate has developed a range of strategies for people development, including the use of training, coaching and mentoring, and when to use them. They have a clear understanding of how to use a coaching management style including using the GROW model, both for formal and informal coaching conversations and in general performance management.
The delegate has a robust knowledge of what makes a team perform effectively, including theories of team development and dysfunctional teams and how to apply these to their role.
The delegate has learned and understood models of emotional intelligence and how to apply these to leadership; drawing links between self-awareness and empathy to become an effective leader.

39773431-c8b3-4298-bf89-e4b374d18b2c.description: The Essential Management Programme is a programme of learning, created and delivered by Eurostar for Managers. The programme has been designed to give managers the essential skills and knowledge they need to succeed in their role as a manager at Eurostar. As they progress through the course, they will be able to observe and support the change in their management approach, style and performance.
39773431-c8b3-4298-bf89-e4b374d18b2c.name: EMP Essential Management Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The EMP Launch - During this session, we will discuss why developing management skills is essential for people manager at Eurostar. The session will describe how the EMP will support participants in gaining the skills, knowledge and experience they need to maximise their potential as a manager. It will also detail the logistics and requirements for successfully completing the EMP.
Moving from team to manager - This workshop will give you a wider perspective to ease your transition from team member to manager.

Bite Size Management Workshop: Absence - This session aims to guide you on your responsibilities for managing sickness absence in your team. It will cover the policy framework, absence triggers, manging long term absence, disability awareness and our obligations under the Equality Act 2010.

Bite Size Management Workshop: Disciplinary - This session aims to guide you on your responsibilities for tackling misconduct, from minor misdemeanours to gross misconduct. This session makes an ideal follow on from the investigation training. It will focus on your responsibilities under the policy and the stages necessary to address an allegation of misconduct.

Bite Size Management Workshop: Grievance - This session aims to guide you on your responsibilities to help resolve a grievance raised by one of your team. The session will help demystify the question “when is a grievance not a grievance” and the different resolution options to possible resolution.

Bite Size Management Workshop: Investigations - This session aims to guide you on the fundamentals of a fair, unbiased, balanced investigation process. It will cover what is expected of you as an investigating officer, how to scope an investigation and key skills required to undertake this role.

Performance Management: Performance Reviews - During this session, we'll focus on performance as an ongoing process that helps team members develop their day-to-day tasks. You'll learn how to review and assess your team's progress against individual and departmental goals and develop the skills and confidence of your team.

Performance Management: Development Conversations - A development conversation is the way you manage performance throughout the year. It is the most important part as with solid development conversations, your reviews will be easy, and you will keep your employees engaged and motivated. The aim of these conversations is to inspire and enable employees to grow while developing their knowledge, skills, and abilities in order to maximise their performance.

Managing a team - During this session, we will cover the key aspects of how to build and manage your team effectively. Through discussions and carefully designed activities you'll get a greater understanding of your team and how to lead them into success.
Engaging and motivating a team - This hands-on workshop gives you the essential tools, techniques and principles you need to boost team motivation, focus, effectiveness and engagement.

Communicating with impact - We will equip you with the awareness, tools and confidence to increase your impact with all stakeholders through effective communication techniques. You will achieve this through self-reflection, peer discussions and practical exercises.

Coaching skills - The aim of this workshop is to provide managers with the skills, competence and confidence to improve their team's performance through a coaching approach. Managers will achieve this through the coaching framework (GROW), peer to peer learning, scenarios and practical exercises.

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will identify their preferred leadership style(s) and learn how to apply the most effective leadership style to engage and motivate their team members.

Demonstrated an appreciation of the financial structure of the organisation alongside an understanding of how their decisions impact on the wider financial health of the business.

804480cd-0ea7-4b4c-8343-9b81430decc0.description: Coaching is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by ted Learning Ltd for team leaders and managers. The programme develops knowledge and skills in Coaching, enabling learners to maximise their team's performance using a coaching approach. Learners develop recognised coaching techniques and improve using coaching practice, feedback and reflection.
804480cd-0ea7-4b4c-8343-9b81430decc0.name: First Steps into Coaching - ted Learning

alignments.name: ILM Recognised
alignments.description: The programme falls within the ILM Footprint of Leadership, Management, Coaching, Mentoring and Enterprise. It is well structured with appropriate governance and management to deliver consistently high-quality learning outcomes and objectives. Learners are fully supported and receive recognition for their achievement.

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the role of coaching in maximising individual performance This learning outcome is covered throughout the programme but is predominantly focused on in session 1, where learners will explore what coaching is, particularly in relation to other techniques such as mentoring, and how different levels of coaching can be utilised effectively dependent on individual abilities and motivations, thus improving performance. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

Explain what it takes to be an effective coach and identify key roles and responsibilities This learnin outcome is covered in the first session, where learners will explore the role of the coach and how coaches support their coachees. Roles & responsibilities, particularly in the context of contracting, are covered in depth to ensure learners understand the professionalism needed in a coaching relationship. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

Describe a recognised coaching model and how different tools and techniques can be used to support it. This outcome is initially covered in the first session where learners are introduced to the GROW model. This knowledge is then built on in session 2 where there is further focus on communication skills around questioning and listening. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

Demonstrate coaching skills and receive feedback to support development This learning outcome is covered throughout the programme as learners meet the course requirement of their practice coaching sessions in between each workshop, and reflect on their experiences through both their journal entries and via discussion and feedback in the subsequent workshop. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

Reflect on and analyse own coaching capability and identify how to improve. This learning outcome is covered throughout the programme as learners use their journal entries (and feedback) to reflect and improve. The third session of the programme explores this in depth with learners understanding techniques to evaluate the success of coaching and also working on challenging limiting beliefs. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

35964da3-6791-4995-aca9-92a1d070402b.description: First Steps into Management is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by ted Learning for new or junior managers. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by supporting their development of key management tools, techniques, skills and behaviours and recognising their progress and potential.
35964da3-6791-4995-aca9-92a1d070402b.name: First Steps into Management - ted Learning

alignments.name: ILM Recognised
alignments.description: The programme falls within the ILM Footprint of Leadership, Management, Coaching, Mentoring and Enterprise. It is well structured with appropriate governance and management to deliver consistently high-quality learning outcomes and objectives. Learners are fully supported and receive recognition for their achievement.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate an understanding of key management skills and how these relate to personal areas for development.

This learning outcome is a particular focus for the first session of the programme, and then is developed throughout each session as learners build on their understanding to develop and enhance their skills, then reflect on these in the context of their own professional development and the goals they set for themselves in the first session.
This outcome maps specifically to the ILM footprint of Management, and as Coaching is a key management skill covered in this programme, it also maps to the ILM footprint of Coaching.

Describe and explain the key skills and behaviours of a manager. This learning outcome is a particular focus for the first session of the programme where learners identify key skills and behaviours. As the programme progresses, they then begin to explore these skills and behaviours in depth and understand how to apply these in their role, building on and embedding their learning througout the programme. This outcome maps specifically to the ILM footprint of Management.

Reflect on personal individual skills and behaviours, identifying areas where improvement would enable more effective management of others. This learning outcome is embedded throughout the whole programme via both discussion and activities in the sessions but mainly through the completion of reflective journals after each session, where learners reflect on the key takeaways from the session and what they will do differently. This outcome maps specifically to the ILM footprint of Management.
Evaluate personal progress and use this information to identify and plan future development.

This learning outcome is a focus of the final reflective journal entry, where learners look back on their individual progress against the goals they set at the start of the programme, and reflect on their achievement. They are also asked to think about what their next developmental steps are, thus providing a focus for continous improvement in their management journey. This outcome maps specifically to the ILM footprint of Management.

478ed090-70f9-4cf4-a5d9-52755c1d1dfa.description: Team Leading is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by ted Learning Ltd for new team leaders. The programme develops knowledge and skills by supporting learners with the team leader fundamentals: managing the challenge of transition to leading others, delegation and task management skills, managing difficult conversations and identification of areas for further self-development.
478ed090-70f9-4cf4-a5d9-52755c1d1dfa.name: First Steps into Team Leading - ted Learning

alignments.name: ILM Recognised
alignments.description: The programme falls within the ILM Footprint of Leadership, Management, Coaching, Mentoring and Enterprise. It is well structured with appropriate governance and management to deliver consistently high-quality learning outcomes and objectives. Learners are fully supported and receive recognition for their achievement.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify challenges they may face in their transition into a team leader role and suggest strategies to overcome these.

This outcome is covered in the first workshop "Your First Steps into Team Leading Programme: Transitioning from Colleague to Line Manager" where learners will explore and share their concerns and challenges around making the transition to managing their peers. After working through these challenges, learners will explore strategies for overcoming these, increasing their confidence.

This learning outcome is also achieved throughout the overall completion of the programme as for some learners there may be specific concerns around difficult conversations or delegation. This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of management as it begins to support learners in confidently executing their first management role.

Explain how effective delegation and task management supports the achievement of team goals. This outcome is covered in workshop two: "Introduction to delegation and task management" which focuses on the key management skill of delgating and managing the workload of others. This workshop explores barriers and challenges to delegation then focuses on best practice around how to delegate, touching on motivation theory and also exploring tools & techniques for succesful task management.
This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of management, as delegation is a key managerial skill.
Outline effective approaches to use when managing difficult situations and / or people.

This outcome is covered in workshop three "Managing difficult situations and challenging people" where learners learn key communication skills to support them in effectively handling difficult conversations and avoiding conflict or escalation. This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of management, as dealing effectively with difficult conversations and situations is a communication based key managerial skill.
Identify areas for own further development to support professional progression.

This outcome is covered both throughout the whole programme journey (as learners will identify areas for further development through the course of their reflective journal answers) and at the end of the programme as learners reflect on what they have learnt and how they can move forwards. The final achievement session uses group reflective activities and discussion to explore this further and learners commit to their future development next steps.
This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprint of leadership, and of management, as it encourages self-reflective practice, a key leadership & management skill.

43e6bee7-6c7d-45e4-bbe7-34983d6ae570.description: Foundation Leadership Skills is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Buffin Leadership International for 1st level leaders of teams. badge_template_activities.title: Module 1 is designed to develop leadership success habits. Gain Sense of Vision, Values of Purpose to lead Teams across the Business Processes for Continuous Improvement

Module 2 equips delegates with the knowledge and skills to coach a team for performance. Gain the foundation of effective Coaching Methods. How to plan, deliver and evaluate their one to one and Team Coaching Sessions

Module 3 teaches delegates the essentials of business finance. How a business performance is measured financially and what success actually looks like. Candidates learn that a profitable company is not necessarily a successful company but that in reality Cash is King. It is vital that any business improvemenmt made by the candidates can be shown to be of financial benefit. Understand how financial performance is measured and can be impacted through decisions and actions taken

Module 4 equips delegates with some powerful facilitation tools which enable detailed and rapid solutions to be formulated to bring about powerful changes .To gain some Key Frameworks, Tools and Techniques to Facilitate Change to inspire and deliver Profitable Outcomes
Module 5 develops the skills to form high performance teams. Understand how to establish commitment in a Team to Motivate and Lead

badge_template_activities.title: Leading through Change - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff already responsible leading policing teams through change in delivering safety and security.

Strategic Thinking - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff already able to work at a strategic and operational levels, to improve their ability to set and direct intent within their areas of responsibility.

Communication - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to raise the effectiveness of their communication such that it retains clarity and direction at both a strategic and operational level, whilst enabling the building and maintenance of relationships as at a more strategic level.

Emotional Intelligence - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to connect with their staff, peers and senior stakeholders and public at a more emotional and behavioural level, taking account of the importance of values-based professional people-centered engagement for those working in delivering public safety and security.

Professional Development - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to understand the importance of continual professional development as part of a more integrated leadership and management approach to improving professionalism and individual and team performance.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has undertaken the module English Independent Project . The assessment strategy for this module is related to the learning outcomes in the following way:
An introductory lecture will be provided in Induction week.

In the first seven weeks of semester 1 students are taught in seminars and are helped to choose a projectoption, define a research topic of appropriate scope and complexity, locate suitable primary and secondary sources,and devise a schedule of work for the remainder of the year.
The goal of this activity is the production of a presentation to the seminar group and a topic proposal submitted to the seminar tutor, which will establish the viability of the research project.

This constitutes a formative point of assessment. Formative feedback is provided by their peers on the presentation and by the seminar tutor on the topic proposal, in order to guide the student (in consultation with their supervisor) in the next phase of their project.

From week 8 of semester 1 onwards students are engaged in researching and writing their Independent Project under the guidance of a supervisor, with whom they meet regularly on a 1:1 basis, comprising a total of 3 hours of supervision. Supervisors provide detailed feedback on any draft material submitted by a certain deadline to help students revise and improve their projects.

University of Chester MBA or the MA/MSc Business and Management for Senior Leaders (WBIS)

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has undertaken the University of Chester Level 7 Organisational Environment module and completed the required assessment of writing a 5,000 word business report to examine the business environment in which the organisation is operating, followed by recommendations for action in response to contemporary challenges.

This individual has undertaken the University of Chester Level 7 Managing and Leading People module and completed the required assessment of 5,000 words to include either a 2,000 word business report and 2,000 word reflective review or a 5,000 word reflective review. Both assessment methods encompass the identification and application of processes to manage and lead people effectively, as well as a review of the effects of one’s own personal performance, attitudes, preferences and behaviours.

This individual has undertaken the University of Chester Level 7 Finance for Non-Financial Managers module and successfully completed the required portfolio of 5,000 words to evidence an understanding of the underlying principles and concepts of finance and accounting, develop the  ability to read and interpret simple financial statements and use structured financial data to assist in the process of management decision making.

This individual has undertaken either the University of Chester Level 7 Marketing module (MBA) or the Level 7 Enterprise and Innovation module (MA/MSc) and successfully completed the required assessment of approximately 5,000 words to demonstrate appropriate knowledge and understanding of the key principles of marketing communication or enterprise and innovation, apply those principles and reflect upon the efficacy of their implementation within their own organisation.

This individual has undertaken either the University of Chester Level 7 Business Strategy and Planning module (MBA) or the Level 7 Transition and Change Management module (MA/MSc) and completed the assessment of writing a 5,000 word portfolio consisting of a business report which identifies, analyses and interprets strategic objectives to inform and implement a business plan consisting of a plan to bring about change. The assessment includes a reflective evaluation of the business plan outcomes.

This individual has undertaken the University of Chester Level 7 Designing Practitioner Research Module and successfully completed the required assessment of approximately 5,000 words. The assessment task enables individuals to demonstrate understanding of the processes required to design robust and persuasive practitioner research projects which have the potential to affect change and influence practice within an organisational setting or profession.

This individual has undertaken the University of Chester Level 7 Negotiated Experiential Learning Module and successfully completed the required assessment of a 10,000 word portfolio, 4,000 word showcase report and 1,000 word presentation. The assessment task requires individuals to engage in experiential learning and apply knowledge, skills and understanding by undertaking an individually negotiated work-based project.

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Developing leadership and management capability through enquiry (8617-700) and successfully met the requirements of the assignment task of an individual 5,000-word assignment against the unit assessment criteria.

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Developing a high-level business case (8617-701) and successfully met the requirements of the assignment task of an individual 5,000-word assignment against the unit assessment criteria.

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Developing and maintaining a high-performance culture and optimising resources (8617-702) and successfully met the requirements of the assignment task of an individual 5,000-word assignment against the unit assessment criteria.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has undertaken the module Sociological Practice – Becoming a Social Scientist. The assessment strategy for this module is related to the learning outcomes in the following way:

Component A is a 25 minute group and enquiry based presentation held in class. It is designed to assess applied knowledge of methods of investigation, presentation and computer skills, time management, teamwork, analytical and information gathering skills. Marks are allocated to the work produced, rather than on an individual basis to reinforce the importance of teamwork and collaboration, as important employability aspects of professional development.
Component B is a written reflective assignment designed to assess understanding of the relevance of sociology to every-day situations and dilemmas alongside academic and writing skills.
The goal of this activity is the production of a presentation to the seminar group and a topic proposal submitted to the seminar tutor, which will establish the viability of the research project.
8600-307: Giving briefings and making presentations

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Giving briefings and making presentations (8607-307) and successfully met the requirements of the unit assessment criteria.

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Solving problems and making decisions (8607-300) and successfully met the requirements of the unit assessment criteria.

UWE Bristol BA (Hons) English Literature and Writing

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has undertaken the module English Independent Project . The assessment strategy for this module is related to the learning outcomes in the following way:
An introductory lecture will be provided in Induction week.

In the first seven weeks of semester 1 students are taught in seminars and are helped to choose a projectoption, define a research topic of appropriate scope and complexity, locate suitable primary and secondary sources,and devise a schedule of work for the remainder of the year.
The goal of this activity is the production of a presentation to the seminar group and a topic proposal submitted to the seminar tutor, which will establish the viability of the research project.

This constitutes a formative point of assessment. Formative feedback is provided by their peers on the presentation and by the seminar tutor on the topic proposal, in order to guide the student (in consultation with their supervisor) in the next phase of their project.

From week 8 of semester 1 onwards students are engaged in researching and writing their Independent Project under the guidance of a supervisor, with whom they meet regularly on a 1:1 basis, comprising a total of 3 hours of supervision. Supervisors provide detailed feedback on any draft material submitted by a certain deadline to help students revise and improve their projects.
8600-307: Giving briefings and making presentations

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Giving briefings and making presentations (8607-307) and successfully met the requirements of the unit assessment criteria.
8600-311: Developing yourself and others

Through alignment to the modules above, it has been validated that the individual has met the requirements of the ILM unit Developing Yourself and Others (8607-311) and successfully met the requirements of the unit assessment criteria.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has undertaken the module Heritage in Practice . The assessment strategy for this module is related to the learning outcomes in the following way:

Essay on the critical application of historiographical approaches to museums and sites of heritage. (2000 words) Consolidating work undertaken in Block One, students will evaluate the application of theoretical approaches in history to the display, management and interpretation of heritage sites in modern Britain. This work will inform their later project work on the critical evaluation of specific sites

Project (6000 words) Students will produce a written project, critically and comparatively evaluating the visitor offer at each of the sites visited during Block 2. These evaluations will include an assessment of the visitor demographic, site management practices, and display/interpretation strategies of each site, and an appreciation of their value as representations of public history.

They understand good practice when coaching in an organisational context and the benefits that coaching can bring to individuals and the organisation. They understand the contracting process and how to manage confidentiality to coach ethically.

This person has undertaken at least 12 hours of effective coaching of others in an organisational environment. They have experienced using a range of tools and techniques to support the application of a coaching model. They have maintained records to monitor progress and achievements. They help to improve organisational performance through coaching and reflect on their own performance as a coach to identify areas for improvement.

82027ac8-cd5f-4ad3-abe7-b7a5a74daf6b.description: This qualification aims to provide the learner with the required knowledge, skills and understanding so they can effectively coach others within an organisational context. ac1b5f8f-82eb-4194-820f-54ec98bea9ae.description: This qualification is for those who wish to gain the knowledge, skills and confidence to effectively coach or mentor people within an organisational context. It is suitable for individuals at all levels and who are either new and existing coaches or mentors. It is also an ideal qualification for those who wish to commence a career in coaching or mentoring. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3738/2 and ILM Qualification Number 8587-62)
ac1b5f8f-82eb-4194-820f-54ec98bea9ae.name: Level 3 Certificate in Effective Coaching and Mentoring - 8587-62

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands good practice for coaching and mentoring in the workplace. They know the roles, responsibilities, behaviours and characteristics of an effective coach and mentor. They understand the contracting process and how to manage confidentiality to coach ethically.

This person is able to manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support effective coaching or mentoring by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They can maintain records and are able to recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

This person has undertaken at least 12 hours of effective coaching or mentoring of others in an organisational environment. They can assess their own abilities as a coach, including reflecting on their communication and interpersonal skills when coaching. They are also able to draw conclusions about their performance and plan for future development needs.

ab7afce5-89a6-4fea-8413-8d4dc1712d6e.description: This qualification is for those who wish to gain the knowledge, skills and confidence to effectively mentor people within an organisational context. They have experienced using a range of tools and techniques to support the application of a mentoring model. They have maintained records to monitor progress and achievements. They help to improve organisational performance through mentoring and reflect on their own performance as a mentor to identify areas for improvement.

7dbd4ce6-16b2-404b-a278-529c46c960b2.description: This qualification is for those who currently have management responsibilities but have not completed any formal training and are seeking to move up to the next level of management. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 600/5961/8 and ILM Qualification Number 8600-62)

1fc122e4-6d0b-4c01-b460-b4dfe444f225.description: This qualification is aimed at sub-contractors, gangers, foreman, team leaders, supervisors, site managers and anyone requiring a thorough understanding of management and leadership principles to effectively lead, supervise and safely manage people across the many different industry sub sectors within the expanding built environment and construction industry. Suitable for learners 16 years old, or over. Accreditation No: 601/5584/X
1fc122e4-6d0b-4c01-b460-b4dfe444f225.name: Level 3 Certificate in L&M for the Construction & Built Environment (Extractive Site Pathway) – 8626-21

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: 1. Understand the roles and responsibilities of a site supervisor or team leader; 2. Understand the differences between leadership and management and the relationship between the two; 3.  Understand the role of quality management in site management; 4. Understand the importance of health and safety in site management

5. Understand the Health, Safety and Environmental impacts when supervising an extractive site; 6.  Understand methods of working in an extractive site; 7.  Understand the safety procedures that must be followed when supervising an extractive site; 8. Understand their role in promoting a positive health and safety culture in an extractive site
This person has completed three of the following five optional units

Unit 301: 1. Understand how to plan work on site; 2. Know how to put team members to work; 3.  Understand how to improve the performance of a team in delivering to plan; 4.  Understand the importance of quality management within the workplace

Unit 302:  1. Understand the importance of stakeholder relationships in making an organisation successful; 2. Understand the role of the supervisor in meeting client requirements; 3.  Understand the role of the supervisor in managing and controlling costs; 4.  Understand the role of the supervisor in minimising waste in an organisation; 5. Understand how keeping records contributes to making an organisation successful

Unit 303: 1.  Understand how to use assessment and active listening and feedback to manage the performance of team members on site; 2.  Understand how to manage poor performance and discipline of team members on site; 3. Understand how to manage conflict on site; 4.  Understand how to identify and manage work-related stress; 5.  Understand how to manage a diverse workforce

Unit 304: 1.  Understand site planning and programme requirements in order to lead and manage people and activities;  2.  Understand the impact of managing resources, time and materials on the plan and programme; 3.  Understand different work methods and their impact on quality, health and safety and the achievement of plans; 4.  Understand how to leverage their leadership and management skills to achieve plan and programme milestones

Unit 305: 1. Understand how their personal leadership style affects the performance of others; 2. Understand how to establish and maintain an effective team;  3. Motivate the team to improve productivity; 4. Understand the importance of communication to team and site performance; 5.  Understand the importance of feedback to individual and team performance; 6. apply a recognised coaching technique to develop and improve the performance of team members
7. Understand how to persuade and influence others to achieve objectives

Unit 400: 1.  Understand how to identify the skills gap between existing and future knowledge and skill requirements  2.  Understand how personal attributes and behaviour affect leadership and management performance  3. implement and monitor a personal development plan to meet an identified skills gap and areas for personal development
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual in England and Northern Ireland

e5abba67-cd73-46dd-8ad7-e18b4c52c33e.description: This qualification is aimed at sub-contractors, gangers, foreman, team leaders, supervisors, site managers and anyone requiring a thorough understanding of management and leadership principles to effectively lead, supervise and safely manage people across the many different industry sub sectors within the expanding built environment and construction industry. badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: o

This person is able to:

b4695fea-790b-44b1-a1a2-09f5e64a42e5.description: The Level 3 Diploma enables active or aspirational Team Leaders or Supervisors who must be in a first line management role, with operational/project responsibilities or responsibility for managing a team, to deliver clearly defined outcomes. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 610/0175/2 and ILM Qualification Number 8411-31)
b4695fea-790b-44b1-a1a2-09f5e64a42e5.name: Level 3 Diploma for Team Leaders 8411-31

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved all the components of the qualification, and developed knowledge, skills and behaviours in nine mandatory units.

Team Development and Resource Management - This person can effectively support and develop individuals and teams in achieving objectives and improving performance. They can also effectively manage resources and change.

Building a High Performance Team - This person understands management models, team dynamics, motivational techniques, learning styles and feedback mechanisms. They can build a high-performing team, set operational and personal goals, monitor progress, share best practice and provide feedback. In addition they can build trust, actively listen, manage conflict, negotiate and influence effectively.

Managing Self - This person can plan and manage their own personal development, including feedback from others, and promote effective time management for self and others. They understand how to be self-aware, unconscious bias and inclusivity.

Communication and Interpersonal Skills - This person can effectively communicate using a range of formats and adaptions to build relationships with customers, teams and management. In addition they understand how to manage challenging conversations, raise concerns and provide constructive feedback.

Organisational Culture and Strategy - This person understands equality, diversity and inclusion and organisational responsibilities in the workplace. They understand how organisational strategy and culture are developed and can communicate the strategy, team purpose and operational plans.

Problem Solving and Decision Making - This person is able to apply problem solving and decision making techniques. They understand the approaches to manage relationships, change and resources. In addition they can implement plans, respond to feedback and seek solutions to meet business needs.

Data Management - This person can manage and protect business data, with an understanding of policies and procedures, the use and benefits of different technologies. They are able to manage data, from the collection, interpretation, analysis and finally the creation of reports that will support decision making.

Organisational Governance - This person has an understanding of HR systems, legal requirements and how to manage performance. They can apply organisational governance and compliance to deliver value for money and ensure effective budget controls.
Project Management - This person understands the project lifecycle, roles and responsibilities. They can deliver and monitor a project using appropriate tools and techniques.
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved all components of the qualification and developed knowledge and skills in all seven mandatory units:

Personal & Professional Development - This person can develop a personal development plan based on their preferred learning and behavioural styles and reflect on the impact of their performance on others. They are a role model of their organisation’s values.
Communication Skills - This person can build and maintain relationships with both internal and external stakeholders using a variety of effective communication formats and techniques.
Managing Teams - This person can use different leadership styles to lead and manage teams while improving performance of both remote and in-person teams.
Business Planning - This person can create and integrate, strategic, operational, and contingency plans to continuously improve business performance.

Operational Planning & Management - This person can undertake operational planning in the workplace, considering the use of technology and data to support the delivery of these plans. They understand how to manage, lead and communicate change in the workplace, and the impact that organisational culture and diversity has on change in the workplace.
Financial Practices - This person understands financial planning and can manage budgets.
Project Planning - This person can plan projects, recognise and overcome barriers, and make decisions.
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved the Level 5 Diploma in Coaching and Mentoring. They understand the purpose of coaching and mentoring in an organisational context and can explain the similarities and differences. They can present the case for the business benefits of coaching and mentoring. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values of an effective coach and mentor.

This person can manage a coaching or mentoring process by agreeing goals and following a recognised model of practice. They can support coaching or mentoring by drawing on a range of tools and techniques. They maintain records and can recognise and overcome barriers to successful coaching and mentoring at work.

This person has completed the three mandatory units: Understanding the Skills, Principles and Practice of Effective Management Coaching and Mentoring, Undertaking an Extended Period of Management Coaching or Mentoring in the Workplace, Reviewing Own Ability as a Management Coach or Mentor

0bd8a27d-8a31-49ed-9497-6fb104cacc0e.description: This qualification is designed for new and aspiring middle managers seeking a thorough grounding in their role and responsibilities, plus the opportunity to consolidate and further develop the key skills and knowledge they need at this level. 0bd8a27d-8a31-49ed-9497-6fb104cacc0e.name: Level 5 Diploma in Principles of Leadership and Management - 8610-34

badge_template_activities.title: This person is able to: 1. Understand the specific responsibilities of middle managers in enabling an organisation to achieve its goals  2.  Understand how communication and interpersonal skills affect managerial performance in the workplace 3. Assess personal development opportunities to improve own managerial performance

This person is able to 1. Understand the effectiveness of the organisation and own ability to manage and improve quality to meet customer requirements 2.  plan and implement projects to meet, and if possible exceed, customer requirements
This person is able to : 1. Understand financial concepts used to inform management decisions. 2. Be able to make a financial case to inform a management decision
This person is able to 1. critically assess own beliefs, attitudes and value systems 2. critically assess the validity of management theories in relation to own beliefs, attitudes and values
This person is able to :  1. Understand the need for innovation and change management within an organisation  2.  Propose innovative solutions to improve organisational performance
This person has completed a range of optional units that enabled them to demonstrate a broad range of core and specialist topics that best fit their individual and organisational requirements.
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual in England and Northern Ireland

53ec952f-1e36-4557-a9e0-cb26b0c625ea.description: This qualification provides professional coaches with the required supervisory knowledge and skills to practice as confident and competent coaching supervisors of coaches. It is suitable for those seeking to enhance and accredit their expertise in the coaching supervision of coaches with a nationally recognised qualification. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3766/7 and ILM Qualification Number 8590-62)
53ec952f-1e36-4557-a9e0-cb26b0c625ea.name: Level 7 Certificate for Coaching Supervisors - 8590-62

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose and ethical principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches and can critically compare different approaches for the effective coaching supervision of coaches. They have an understanding of the anticipated outcomes of effective coaching supervision for different stakeholders.

This person can support organisations to provide in-house coaching. They can plan, deliver and review the coaching supervision of coaches. They can develop coaches who are able to use the feedback from supervisory sessions to plan their own and others’ professional development.

This person has undertaken at least 20 hours effective coaching supervision. They can assess their own abilities as a supervisor of coaches. They are also able to reflect in a structured way and draw conclusions about their performance to plan for future development needs. They understand the principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches in practice and how to evaluate the overall benefits.

02d56163-c5c6-4d69-962a-16432f689ba0.description: This qualification aims to provide professional coaches with the deep supervisory knowledge and skills needed to practice as confident and competent coaching supervisors of coaches. It is for those seeking to enhance and accredit their expertise in the coaching supervision of coaches with a nationally recognised qualification. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3767/9 and ILM Qualification Number 8590-63)
02d56163-c5c6-4d69-962a-16432f689ba0.name: Level 7 Diploma for Coaching Supervisors - 8590-63

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose and ethical principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches and can critically compare different approaches for the effective coaching supervision of coaches. They can develop an understanding of the anticipated outcomes of effective coaching supervision for different stakeholders.

This person can support organisations to provide in-house coaching. They can plan, deliver and review the coaching supervision of coaches. They can develop coaches who are able to use the feedback from supervisory sessions to plan their own and others’ professional development.

This person has undertaken at least 60 hours effective coaching supervision. They can assess their own abilities as a supervisor of coaches. They are also able to reflect in a structured way and draw conclusions about their performance to plan for future development needs. They understand the principles of effective coaching supervision of coaches in practice and how to evaluate the overall benefits.

13be78bf-c3db-4c91-ba32-3164f164aee1.description: This qualification is for professional coaches at an executive or senior level to gain further knowledge and skills. It is suitable for senior managers or Human Resources/Organisation Development professionals who wish to develop their expertise and credibility in the fields of Executive and Senior level coaching and mentoring, or to establish a coaching culture at an organisational level. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/3763/1 and ILM Qualification Number 8589)
13be78bf-c3db-4c91-ba32-3164f164aee1.name: Level 7 Diploma for Executive and Senior Level Coaches and Mentors (8589-63)

badge_template_activities.title: This person understands the purpose of coaching and mentoring within an organisational context and can develop strategies to overcome organisational barriers to coaching. They understand the skills, behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and values that an effective coach or mentor requires and the need to manage relationships ethically.

This person can apply a range of coaching models to coach others and is able to explore the expectations and boundaries of their stakeholders. They can establish and build effective coaching or mentoring relationships with clients at a senior/strategic level. They can review clients’ development needs and progress towards achieving their goals, maintaining relevant records in line with organisational requirements.

This person has undertaken at least 60 hours effective coaching or mentoring at an executive or senior level. They can reflect on all coaching or mentoring activity, feedback and supervision to reach conclusions about their own performance.

794a65de-8191-46c0-867c-a6567d13097e.description: The Level 7 Diploma for Senior Leaders enables active senior leaders to provide clear, inclusive, and strategic leadership and direction within an organisation. (Ofqual Qualification Number: 603/7778/1 and ILM Qualification Number 8431-31/33/63)
794a65de-8191-46c0-867c-a6567d13097e.name: Level 7 Diploma for Senior Leaders 8431-31 Pass

badge_template_activities.title: This person has successfully achieved all the components of the qualification, and developed knowledge and skills in seven mandatory units
Building a High Performance Team – This person can lead and influence people, drive continuous improvement, and develop a high performance team
Strategic Leadership – This person can set strategic direction in response to changing markets and stakeholder requirements, and work with a diverse range of stakeholders

Strategic Change Management – This person can shape an organisation’s mission, culture, and values, collaborate with others, and develop strategies to drive change to improve the organisation’s sustainability and establish a creative and innovative environment
Organisational Values & the Strategic Context – This person can implement a high performance strategy, shape communications strategy, and develop a Corporate Social Responsibility programme

Strategic Influencing & Negotiating – This person can communicate and translate organisational vision into operational strategies, and use influencing and negotiating strategies to enhance brand and reputation
Strategic Data Analysis – This person can use research methodologies, financial strategies, and critical analysis to support decision making and deliver creative solutions

Strategic Workforce & Logistics Planning – This person can drive a culture of resilience and support through their use of strategic workforce planning, and oversee procurement, supply chain and contract management.
This qualification is regulated by Ofqual

Senior Leaders are a key component of all types of business where there is a workforce to lead, manage & support. They contribute to the execution & achievement of strategic objectives, working in varied environments. This EPA assessed the apprentice against the employer-defined knowledge, skills & behaviours of the Apprenticeship Standard.

badge_template_activities.title: This person has been independently assessed by ILM and has achieved all the distinction criteria for the End-point Assessment.

A Senior Leader provides inclusive, strategic leadership and direction to their area of responsibility within an organisation. This involves setting, managing and monitoring achievement of core objectives aligned to the organisation’s strategic objectives. They influence at a higher organisational level and set the culture and tone across their area of responsibility. They demonstrate a high level of flexibility and adaptability.
End-point assessment components: Strategic Business Proposal, Presentation & Questioning Professional Discussion, with underpinning Portfolio of Evidence

This learner has completed a range of optional units that includes  Business Strategy, Organisational governance, culture and values, Human Resources, Financial Resources, Management, Quality and Continuous Improvement Strategy, EDI, Business Processes, Collaborative Relationships, Use of Technology, Service Development and Marketing Activities.

badge_template_activities.title: Motivational Interviewing – This individual has gained skills in how to use motivational interviewing techniques and advanced communication skills to enhance the effectiveness of patient contact. 19f98d04-0807-4989-9751-634b05db3e96.description: Management 4.0 is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Human Development Solutions for managers. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by guiding learners through the 5 essential modules of management: Managing Employee Engagement; Coaching and Providing Feedback; Managing Conflict; Managing Performance; Managing Individual and Career Development.
19f98d04-0807-4989-9751-634b05db3e96.name: Management 4.0 - Human Development Solutions

badge_template_activities.title: Module 1: Managing Employee Engagement Identify employee’s skill, confidence and motivation levels Learn different leadership styles to match different employee needs Drive sense of urgency and manage resistors

Module 2: Coaching and Providing Feedback Learn what great coaching looks like in practice Determine roles and responsibilities of coach and coachee Learn a coaching model and practice key coaching skills Coach employees to become agile learners

Module 3: Managing Conflict Identify key causes of disagreements and how these can escalate to conflict Address negative emotions when conflicts arise Communicate to discover common ground Techniques to manage and prevent conflict

Module 4: Managing Performance State the principles, process and benefits of managing performance Understand performance patterns and drivers of high, medium and under performance Create mutually agree performance objectives
Module 5: Managing Individual and Career Development Facilitate discussions to structure a mutually agreed and meaningful development plan
