9815ccdd-a4e9-4fa7-953f-2c3392e9c803.description: Management Fundamentals is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by The Executive Coaching Consultancy for managers at Telereal Trillium. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by practicing the essential skills of management, reflecting on best practice, and understanding how these can be applied in the workplace to manage their direct and project teams to deliver success for themselves, the team, and for the organisation.
9815ccdd-a4e9-4fa7-953f-2c3392e9c803.name: Management Fundamentals Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:
Developed a deep understanding of management strategies for driving organisational change and preparing for the future.
Developed skills to face workplace challenges and maintain team performance.
Raised awareness of self & impact on others as a manager.
Explored skills and tools to aid setting objectives, giving feedback, coaching individuals, and developing teams.
Enhanced their self-awareness and skills to manage in an inclusive way.

45624f77-8c2b-43b2-9d00-1bc137936e54.description: Management and Leadership Skills is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Al-Tawail Management Consulting and Training for practicing managers and for individuals who are candidates for managerial positions. The programme aims to develop an overall understanding of the managerial and leadership functions, responsibilities, and best practices and to help trainees to apply them in the workplace.
45624f77-8c2b-43b2-9d00-1bc137936e54.name: Management & Leadership - Al-Tawail Management Consulting and Training

badge_template_activities.title: Examined and understood the challenges that face managers in our contemporary work environment and the need for adaptation. They developed a developmental action plan to sharpen their skills and raise their effectiveness and productivity.
Understood the various leadership styles to can choose the style that fits the situation they face.
Understood the difference between power and authority and can positively influence others to improve their productivity at work.
Understood the basic aspects of motivation and can inspire and motivate people around them.
Examined and studied many best leadership practices and can apply them at work.

e6890963-2e99-4b5b-bc50-ce24e8292181.description: Management Development Program is an ILM Recognized program of learning, created and delivered by Formatech for business professionals. The program aims to develop knowledge and skills by introducing learners how to direct other employees to ensure they achieve company goals. Understanding the various objectives for managers can help them improve their leadership skills and produce better results at work.
e6890963-2e99-4b5b-bc50-ce24e8292181.name: Management Program - Formatech

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the importance of Behavioural Interviews to hire the “best fit”
Convey believability by ensuring the verbal, vocal, and visual elements of their communications deliver a consistent message
Learn how to give Constructive Feedback
Identify the differences between coaching and mentoring
Use a basic coaching model

32055714-7e8e-4bb4-8125-35314682cd4e.description: Management for Business is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by CCW-Training Academy for individuals looking to start their own businesses. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by providing 5 days of training surrounding problem solving, business case, tendering for jobs, and more skills useful for a business owner.
32055714-7e8e-4bb4-8125-35314682cd4e.name: Management Programme for Business / SME's

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:

Developed an understanding of what differences there are between a manager and a leader. They will have understood how being a manager or a leader can affect how they work, and how you need to not only manage but lead your workplace.

Expanded their knowledge on change management and how to solve and manage problems. They will have understood the realities of change and how to ensure a smooth transition for change within a business environment.

Developed the ability to write bids to win tenders as well as gained an understanding of how to manage business development and staff development. The individual will have understood why developing your staff can help expand your business.

Understood the variety of project management tools and techniques available to them to ensure high-quality project management. They will have newly acquired abilities in project management to ensure they are able to manage projects to deadlines.
Learned new facilitation skills and understand the importance of facilitation within the workplace. They will have understood when facilitation is necessary and how to use it properly.

a3d20d3c-48c8-47da-a0b8-888f051195d3.description: Management Skills is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created, and delivered by Select Training and Management Consultancy. Nowadays multiple tasks and responsibilities are expected from office managers which can be overwhelming. This course is designed to give learners the required key skills for the smooth running of an office! Learn how to build a more effective office atmosphere and reduce workplace inefficiency. We will also go over processes that you can adopt in your office.
a3d20d3c-48c8-47da-a0b8-888f051195d3.name: Management Skills - Select Training and Management Consultancy

badge_template_activities.title: Recognised the limitations of the traditional management theories.
Learned emotional intelligence and how to use it to develop your leadership abilities.
Learned One Minute Managing and how to eliminate negativity.
Gained Leadership and Influencing skills.
Acquire change and conflict management skills.

a88cbc13-76ae-4b7e-996f-016dd8ddc196.description: Management Training is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by CCW - Training Academy, for aspiring managers and managers within a management role looking to progress. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by developing Communication, Understanding concepts of motivation, and how to Develop yourself and your team.
a88cbc13-76ae-4b7e-996f-016dd8ddc196.name: Management Training

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:
Understood how to communicate both hear and be heard. They will understand why communication is important, and how they can use different techniques to ensure they get their points across clearly.

Developed motivational techniques and gained an understanding of the concept of motivation. They will be able to motivate their team, employees, and those who work around them to turn out high-quality productivity.

An understanding of how to develop themselves and their team. They will know the different techniques, forms, and abilities necessary to ensure they can develop themselves and others to their highest possible level.

Understood how to inspire their team, the different techniques necessary, and how they can lead properly to ensure high productivity. They will have developed motivational techniques to be able to gain high commitment from their team.

b9db0d91-925c-48c4-9cde-e7dda037b6fe.description: Manager Development Programme is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Broadlands for managers, supervisors and team leaders. The programme aims to develop knowledge, competency and skills in coaching and mentoring, enabling learners to develop others. In addition, learners will be better placed to align individual and team objectives with strategic goals and to initiate improvements in their own area of work, along with measures to enhance personal and team impact.
b9db0d91-925c-48c4-9cde-e7dda037b6fe.name: Manager Dev Programme - Broadlands

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:
Understood how to coach and mentor effectively using the GROW model.
Identified potential barriers to coaching and mentoring, along with strategies to deal with them.
Understood and applied mission, vision, values, and strategic goals in aligning team, section, and individual objectives.
Understood the process and are able to delegate to and empower others.
Examined their own management/leadership style to effect positive change.

2c6693fb-981b-4770-83df-961b38decced.description: Managing Inclusionis an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by ted Learning for managers of all levels. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by increasing learner's awareness of inclusion, equality and diversity challenges in the workplace and support learners with how to positively manage these issues to encourage an inclusive culture that drives business success.
2c6693fb-981b-4770-83df-961b38decced.name: Managing a culture of Inclusion, Equality and Diversity - ted Learning

alignments.name: ILM Recognised
alignments.description: The programme falls within the ILM Footprint of Leadership, Management, Coaching, Mentoring and Enterprise. It is well structured with appropriate governance and management to deliver consistently high-quality learning outcomes and objectives. Learners are fully supported and receive recognition for their achievement.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the implications of bias and how it can negatively impact different aspects of organisational culture and processes. This learning outcome is covered in both sessions 1 and 2. Learners will explore the origins of bias and begin to raise their self-awareness, supporting them to understand the impact bias can have on their decision making. and how this influences others and the wider organisation. This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprints of Management and Leadership.

Demonstrate how to effectively conduct difficult conversations that support others to recognise when their biases and behaviours are unhelpful or potentially offensive to others. This learning outcome is covered mainly in the final session of the programme. Learners will work on how to approach difficult conversations around inclusion, focusing on communication skills to support positive interactions. This outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprints of Management and Leadership.

Determine specific steps they will take to support and manage inclusivity in their organisation. This learning outcome is covered throughout the programme, being fully realised via the self-reflective final journal question, where, having completed the 3 sessions, learners will reflect on the specific actions they plan to take to manage a positive, inclusive culture in their organisation. This learning outcome specifically maps to the ILM footprints of Management and Leadership.

c7c2f124-26fa-45bc-a184-7833bfda1698.description: In this course, we will give you a real insight into what drives individual behavior, how to pinpoint the cultural style of your organization. We’ll explore team dynamics in the context of the culture, look at functional and dysfunctional behavior, and how dysfunctional behavior can be reshaped. We’ll explore how easy it is for the leader to unwittingly set people up for failure and how this can be avoided. We’ll investigate motivation, reward, and getting the best from the team.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential have:

Developed their personal skills. They will know how they can develop themselves and in turn how to develop others that they manage.

Understood how to write a bid document and a business case. They will understand the different abilities required to write a successful bid document and how they can best use their teams abilities to create high-quality bids.

Improved and developed their communication, H R, and interviewing skills. They will have understood why communication and HR are important to any manager, and how these can affect how successfully they manage their teams.

badge_template_activities.title: Managing through Change - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff already responsible leading policing teams through change in delivering safety and security.

Strategic Management - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff already able to work at a strategic and operational levels, to improve their ability to interpret, set and oversee individuals and teams within their areas of responsibility.

Communication - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to raise the effectiveness of their communication such that it retains clarity and direction at an operational level, whilst enabling the building and maintenance of relationships as at a more strategic level.

Emotional Intelligence - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to connect with their staff, peers and senior stakeholders and public through the critical thinking and peer review opportunities given through assessment and group work that allows them to interact at a more emotional and behavioural level, taking account of the importance of values-based professional people-centered engagement for those working in delivering public safety and security.

Professional Development - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to understand the importance of continual professional development as part of a more integrated leadership and management approach to improving professionalism and individual and team performance.

0b07eb26-8a13-43b1-8f49-050c542b6685.description: Police Leadership Promotion Program (Stage2) is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Rabdan Academy for UAE Ministry of Interior. Communication - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to raise the effectiveness of their communication such that it retains clarity and direction at both a strategic and operational level, whilst enabling the building and maintenance of relationships as at a more strategic level.

Emotional Intelligence - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to connect with their staff, peers and senior stakeholders and public at a more emotional and behavioural level, taking account of the importance of values-based professional people-centered engagement for those working in delivering public safety and security.

Professional Development - Enhancing the knowledge, competence and confidence of Officers and staff to understand the importance of continual professional development as part of a more integrated leadership and management approach to improving professionalism and individual and team performance.

badge_template_activities.title: Understand mediation and conflict resolution in the workplace . This individual understands the role of the workplace mediator and the benefits of dealing with conflict in the workplace. They understand the signs, causes and effects of conflict. They know the roles, responsibilities, skills and behaviours of a meditator and how to decide on appropriate types of intervention. They also know how mediation links to organisation's HR policies and practices and mediation strategies.

Plan a mediation intervention to find a conflict resolution. This individual knows the '5-stage mediation strategy' and has prepared and practiced a workplace mediation intervention. This individual understands the details and importance of a 'mediation agreement' and its essential components. They also know how to deal with a "no agreement" outcome. This individual received peer and trainer/assessor feedback from practical activities to assess their skills and behaviours.

Reflective practice. This individual explored the benefits and challenges of workplace mediation, including possible equality and diversity issues. They are able to reflect on their own mediation practice, self-awareness, learning points and action plans.

f6a4c24b-8795-4c2a-b070-6b4be4de06a7.description: International Leadership of Youth Programs is an ILM Recognised programme of learning, created and delivered by Smart Expertises Trading Company for working with young people. The programme aims to develop knowledge and skills by Supervisors of youth programs in youth institutions, programs, and clubs. • Activity supervisors in secondary schools and universities. • Heads of voluntary groups. • Those responsible for youth programs in the community development committees.
